direction.raw_text: .   Haven't heard that one in awhile. The woman, MAE, 45, a dog-tired waitress, punches in the numbers and returns to her post behind the counter. A lonesome HANK WILLIAMS tune pours forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not since last night.     How's the pie? RED GARNETT, 60, a grizzled but handsome Texas Ranger, sits at the counter slowly chewing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kinda rubbery.   It was better yesterday. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16A   CONTINUED:                                                     16A MAE Same pie as yesterday. Not much call for rhubarb. Sell one slice a day. In the background we hear a SIREN. Red turns and watches a police patrol car whiz past, lights on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer off duty. Tell me, if I stopped bakin' 'em would you still come by every night? Red, preoccupied, takes another rubbery bite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Mae smiles and turns her back to Red as she cleans the grill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, Red Garnett, you don't come in here for the coffee and pie. You come in here for the company. To see me. Another patrol car races past.   Red's eyes follow it. 16B   ANGLE ON MAE                                                   16B MAE Now that I've said that, I'll go   one better. What say I cook you dinner at my   place sometime? Steaks, baked taters,    cold beer, the works. Well?... I'm askin'    you out. She turns to face Red but he's gone. A coupla dollars lie next to the half-eaten pie. All she can do is sigh. 16C   INT./EXT. PATROL CAR - NIGHT                                   16C Red pulls up in front of a small house in a residential section of town. Police cars are everywhere and several officers are behind their vehicles, guns pointed at the house. Red steps out of the car and is greeted by a POLICE SERGEANT, about the same age as Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long time, no see. What are you doin' here, Chief?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't sleep.   Whattaya got? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16C   CONTINUED:                                                    16C They walk. Red arrives at a truck with a 10 gallon coffee urn roped to the tailgate. He grabs a paper cup and pours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy holdin' his family hostage. She kicked him out, served him divorce papers, he came back drunk and pulled a .38. Fired two shots but we don't think anybody's hit. Actually you might know the guy from your sheriff days. Hayden Webb. Been on suspension for awhile. Ring any bells?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   Lemme talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No can do.   Police jurisdiction. Red tastes the coffee -- cold. He spits it out, pours the contents of the cup on the ground and walks toward the front yard. Sergeant follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how are you guys doin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got specific rules to follow in these kinda situations, Red. (gives in) He won't talk. Jus' keeps yellin', crying and waving his gun around. Red moves forward into the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least use the megaphone, you stubborn jackass! But Red ignores and arrives at the front door.   He knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hayden, this is Red Garnett. We worked together a few years back. Mind if I come in? The YELLING inside STOPS and the door opens a crack.   HAYDEN, 35, distraught, peers out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Evenin', Chief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave it to the P.D. They got a three- ring circus out there and not one cup of hot coffee. You mind? Hayden mulls it over, then opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16D   INT. WEBB HOUSE - NIGHT                                        16D On the couch sits Hayden's wife, JULIE, cradling her two kids, an infant and an 8-year-old boy. Julie sobs. Her eye and temple are bruised purple. Red slowly enters, nods to Julie, takes off his hat and sets it on a lampstand. Hayden has moved away from Red against the wall. He holds the gun out at no one in particular.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julie, put a pot of coffee on. She slowly gets up and moves to the kitchen, still weeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appreciate it.   Jus' what is it you want, Hayden?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno... I want my job.    I want my family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd they suspend you for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I answer a call in South Austin. Girl gettin' raped, that's the word. I bust in the door, this lowlife is beatin' the shit outta her with a tire iron. 'Help me, help me,' she says. I take the guy down. He bites me. I break his arm. Case closed, right? No. She was his wife and they both sue me and the department. The guy's about to kill her and she sues me 'cause now he can't pump gas. They have chump change in the bank but they got the best lawyer in town. Three months I'm goin' crazy. No pay. Then my wife leaves me and I get served divorce papers by John Reese -- a sheriff's man. You know how embarrassin' that is? What's happenin', Chief? I mean, everybody's got a fuckin' lawyer! Julie emerges from the kitchen and retakes her seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You love her?    Love the kids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why do you hit me! Hayden grips the quivering revolver tight and points it at her. Red calms the situation... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16D   CONTINUED:                                                        16D RED You don't wanna shoot her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God I think I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, Hayden, I don't     think so. I think you love her. You know      what else I think? That you'd like a way out     of this whole mess... That's where I come     in. 16E   EXT. HOUSE - NIGHT                                                16E Sergeant and other cops stand around and watch the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll be damned. NEW ANGLE The front door opens and Julie emerges with her two kids. She takes a few cautious steps, then runs to the police. 16F   INT. HOUSE - NIGHT                                                16F Red sits on the coffee table, unloading Hayden's gun.       He opens the cylinder and drops the shells to the floor. A calmer Hayden exits the kitchen with Red's coffee.       Red accepts it, takes a sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hits the spot. Hayden starts to sob a bit.      Red hands over a handkerchief which Hayden accepts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No cuffs, huh, Chief?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.   You ready? Hayden nods, they stand. Red picks up his hat, sticks it on his head, opens the door and holds it for... Hayden, transfixed by the multitude of lights outside.      He gulps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll walk out together, okay? Hayden steps back, looks at Red, then reaches behind his back, underneath his shirt and pulls out a .22 pistol. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16F   CONTINUED:                                                      16F HAYDEN Any good officer has a back-up. Red holds his palms out and takes a step toward Hayden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme have it, Hayden. Hayden points the gun at Red, freezing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I a good officer, Chief? Red nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was I a good deputy? The kinda man you could depend on to do what's right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Hayden smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Then he turns the GUN on himself, swallows the barrel and BLOWS his brains out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 16G   EXT. HOUSE - NIGHT (LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hayden's dead, covered body is carried out the door.    Julie screams and sobs, still holding her crying children. Red, looking pretty shook up, slowly exits the house. He stops and looks at Julie and the kids. His eyes lock with the little boy's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a call, Chief Garnett.   They're lookin' for ya downtown. Red slowly walks away.   The little boy's eyes follow him. 17    INT. CONVENIENCE STORE - NIGHT                                  17 It's a small town version of a 7-11, kept open by an owner anxious to cash in on the later night munchies of beer drinkers. Good idea. Bad luck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 17   CONTINUED:                                                     17 Jerry skims through a girly magazine, turning the pages with the gun. Butch, wearing Larry's plaid jacket, jimmies open the cash register. He looks to the floor then to... Jerry, who catches Butch's gaze, holds it, looks down at the floor, then, smiling, looks back to Butch. He returns to the skin mag. Butch holds his stare at Jerry then, in one move, grabs a wad of cash and hops over the counter and out of the store. Jerry notices Butch leaving, grabs a handful of assorted Brach's candies and hurries after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, wait up! Jerry's feet scurry through a pool of blood and past a quivering hand. 18   INT. D.P.S. - TEXAS RANGERS HEADQUARTERS - NIGHT               18 It's very late, after midnight, and only a handful of people, half of whom are cleanup crews, shuffle through the offices. A light from an office at the end of the hall catches our eye. A MUFFLED  VOICE over the phone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understan' your concern, Johnny. 19   INT. RED'S OFFICE - NIGHT                                      19 Red, behind a huge    ranchstyle desk covered with files and paper, sips coffee    with one hand, works a buffalo nickel through magician's    paces with the other and balances the phone receiver in    the crook of his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cons are creatures o' habit. Like old coyotes, they'll crawl back into familiar holes. Uh huh... Yeah... Sure yer' right. Listen you go back to bed and I'll call you in the A.M. with an update. I'll have the files by then. Say hullo to the Mrs.. Red sighs, puts the PHONE back in the hook and stares at it until it RINGS again. 20   INT. PERRY HOUSE - NIGHT (JUST BEFORE DAWN)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 21   INT. PERRY LIVING ROOM - NIGHT                                 21 As the kitchen light comes on we see that the couch has been opened up to a bed in which all three children sleep. The twins sleep soundly but Phillip tosses and turns away from the light. 22   EXT. NEIGHBORHOOD - NIGHT                                      22 The Impala creeps through the previously seen neighborhood without its lights. 23   INT. IMPALA - NIGHT                                            23 Butch drives while Jerry scours the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a Buick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't want a Buick. Want a Ford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ford's leak oil.     A car's a car. Butch puts on the brakes and brings the car to a stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then take the Buick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soon as we cross state line I'll do just that. (beat) I'm tired of riding around. I'll check down the block... for a Ford! Jerry gets out, slams the door, lights a cigarette and walks away. Butch waits a few seconds, quietly turns the key one notch and checks the gas ggauge. It reads almost empty. He taps it with his finger but it doesn't budge. He sighs, looks up and sees... JERRY as he checks one locked car, then feeling eyes on his back, turns, looks at Butch, grins and disappears around a corner. BUTCH discreetly exits the car himself, carefully closing the door without a sound. 24   INT. PERRY KITCHEN - NIGHT                               24 Gladys steps into a slip and snaps her bra while cracking eggs into a skillet. By rote she salts, stirs, and pops bread into the toaster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 25    EXT. PERRY BACKYARD - SOMEONE'S POV - NIGHT                  25 FROM BEHIND a fence, THROUGH the opened, screened windows we see Gladys at work. Phillip enters, dressed in cotton briefs and a T-shirt, drags a chair from the kitchen table by the window and assists his mother by buttering the toast. POV MOVES CLOSER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Phillip. Go wake up your sisters. Phillip dutifully steps down and returns to the living room. Gladys works to adjust her slip, then grabs plates and silverware and takes them to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take mine fried. 26    INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT                                         26 Gladys gasps at Jerry's face pressed against the screen, but controls herself when he brandishes the pistol. He motions for her to open the back door. She does. He slides into the room and sits down at the table. 27    EXT. ON STREET - NIGHT                                       27 A Ford sits in a driveway. In the far b.g. a back porch light glares. Butch ENTERS FRAME, looks at the light, turns to the Ford and starts to jimmie the lock. No luck. He rises and looks to the light. 28    INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT                                         28 Jerry stuffs a piece of toast in his mouth, grins at Gladys and makes a motion to the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lil' on the bland side.   Gimme' that ketchup. She picks up a bottle of Heinz and inches toward him. When she gets close, he grabs her and forces her onto his lap. He holds the gun to her throat and whispers in her ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't got a man around here, do ya'? 29A   INT. NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE - NIGHT                                29A MR. CUMMINGS, 70, puts on his glasses and peers through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 29B   HIS POV - PERRY KITCHEN                                        29B Gladys sits on Jerry's lap, thanks to .38 caliber coercion. The convict's hands move freely over the frightened woman's body. 30    INT. PERRY KITCHEN - NIGHT                               30 JERRY Feed me, sweet thing. Her shaking hands raise a forkful of eggs to his lips.    He licks them once then gobbles with gusto. Phillip enters the room and stops dead in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well lookie here, you do got a man! Jerry smiles at Phillip while he kisses and licks Glady's neck. At once, Phillip darts across the room at Jerry, who backhands the boy with his gunhand, sending Phillip sprawling. Butch blasts through the door in an instant. With a swift kick to the head, Jerry is knocked senseless onto the floor against the cabinets. The gun slides across the floor and lands at Phillip's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm bleedin'! You happy? Butch gives Jerry an icy stare and kneels down to eye level with Phillip. Butch looks at the gun and then at Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name, boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ph...   Phillip...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, okay Phillip. Reach down and pick up that pistola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut yer' mouth. (to Phillip) Pick it up and bring it over here. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 30   CONTINUED:                                                    30 Phillip reaches down and slowly picks up the gun by the handle. He takes one step toward Butch, then another. Gladys, petrified, sobs. Phillip arrives armslength from Butch. CLOSEUPS - PHILLIP AND BUTCH BUTCH Now say 'stick 'em up.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick 'em up... Butch laughs and then a NOISE from outside brings him back to reality. He grabs the gun and spins to see... MR. CUMMINGS Standing outside the screen door, gun leveled. Before the old man can utter a syllable, Butch grabs Phillip and points the gun straight at Cummings. Jerry jumps up and grabs Gladys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the gun down, old timer. You couldn't hit me anyway. Probably shoot the boy. The PHONE RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave it be. The twins wiping sleep from their eyes, wander into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right, honey. PHONE continues to RING. Cummings can't decide what to do with the gun he's pointing at Butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You deaf?!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Set it on the ground. Cummings reluctantly obeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta' get the hell outta'here! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 30   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up! In one fluid move he rips the phone from the wall.    The silence is deafening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I vote we bring her with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How we gonna' get outta' here without a hostage, tell me that? The whole goddam neighborhood's awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll take the boy. Silence.   Gladys can't believe her ears.   Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nooooo!!! Jerry tosses Gladys aside. She collapses onto the floor. The TWINS instantly start to CRY. Phillip winds up and hits Butch as hard as he can. Butch picks him up, directs Cummings into the kitchen with the gun and nods for Jerry to lead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll get him back. I swear it. 31   EXT. FRONT YARD - DAWN                                            31 Butch, carrying Phillip, and Jerry emerge from the back of the house and race back to the Impala.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip!!!!... Butch flips Jerry the gun, tosses Phillip into the passenger seat, leaps over the hood and into the driver's seat. The CAR STARTS and SQUEALS away. Neighbors, aroused by the noise, exit their homes clad in robes, nighties and curlers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 32   INT. CAR - DAWN                                                 32 Jerry FIRES a SHOT over their heads, sending them to the deck or scurrying for safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't you folks ever heard of sleepin' in?!! 33   EXT. PERRY YARD - DAWN                                          33 Cummings races from behind the house with the SHOTGUN, levels it and FIRES a BLAST... A nearby station wagon WINDOW SHATTERS. Rising from their cover position, its owners look at Cummings with disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice shootin', Fred. 34   INT. RED'S OFFICE - DAY                                         34 Garnett, still in the same clothes, rests the phone receiver in his ear while he shuffles through the files before him. Red's deputy and boy friday, TOM ADLER, 40, lank, thinning hair, with a face as soft as Red's is hard, warms up Red's coffee with a jolt from the Chief's favorite plaid Thermos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Johnny, I do understand that... The jabbering on the other end of the phone line continues as Red's eyes squint to read the files. INSERT - FILES The first is Jerry's, complete with a grinning mug shot in the upper right hand corner. There are several pages in the file, but Red's fingers quickly peruse the top rap sheet before turning to... INSERT - SECOND FILE It's Butch's and again Red's fingers start to move down the page then they stop and move to the photo of Butch at the top of the page. RED'S FACE A hint of recognition.    The jabbering continues... CLOSEUP - PHOTO OF BUTCH A little younger than now.    A younger con with the grim facade of a man facing hard time. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   CONTINUED:                                                        34 RED keeps staring at the photo, oblivious to the phone conversa- tion he's "not having".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red?     Red, you there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's talkin' to ya'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you heard a word I've said?! Red comes to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Johnny. Jus' thinkin' is all....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Press has been waiting almost an hour, Red. Red nods then notices someone at the door and motions her in... SALLY GERBER, 28, cute in a plain, no nonsense way, with giant curls accenting her round face in step with the latest hair fashions, enters the room, closes the door behind her. She's nervous as hell but trying to hide it. Red motions her to have a seat while he finishes his call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.... Clear as a bell... Mi' sabe. Red hangs up the phone, takes a draw on the coffee mug and looks again at the file. He seems lost in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   CONTINUED:   (2)                                                   34 ADLER The Guvner', Red. Red closes the file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reminded me it's an election year. Red turns his attention to Sally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drink before noon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.     Last one I had was on a liquid diet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Secretary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penny Munroe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you have me confused. I'm here from Huntsville. Assigned by Governor Connally. Red is confused.     He turns a blank expression to Adler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adler...    what is this? Adler searches the messy desk for something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rings a bell, Red. Believ' they sent us something about her this mornin'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who sent?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Guvner', Red. Adler finds the telex message sheet he's looking for and hands it to Red. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Here it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, I'm Sally Gerber. Criminologist with the State Prison System. Sally offers her hand. Red, perusing the telex, ignores but Adler shakes somewhat reluctantly, not sure if he's supposed to like her or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tom Adler.   Deputy. State Police... System.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a relatively new procedure but I was assigned by Governor Connally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 'to work with State law enforcement officials in all affairs where penal matters coincide with those of the State Police.' It don't say nuthin' about...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... It includes parole and work release programs as well as penal escape situations. The office PHONE BUZZES.    Adler picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On our way, Marge. Adler hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gettin' antsy, Red. You scheduled it. Adler hangs up, grabs Red's tie and coat from a brass rung on the wall and hands them over. Red puts down the telex, stares at Sally and reluctantly attempts to make himself presentable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The idea is that an understanding of the particular behavioral case histories should, in parole situations, help the subject to avoid habitual traps and, in penal escape situations could, conversely, identify those self-same traps as an aide to apprehension. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the first place, Miss Gerber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sally, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the first place, Sally, it ain't a 'penal escape situation.' It's a manhunt. Fancy words in a circle don't help much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what does?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A nose like a Blue Tick, a medulla with an antenna and one helluva lot of coffee. And with that he's out the door. 35   INT. PRESS ROOM - DAY                                         35 A throng of photogs and news writers stuff the undersized room. The clamor settles when Red enters and steps behind the lectern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen up, I'll only say it once. At approximately ten o'clock last night two inmates over to Huntsville, Robert 'Butch' Haynes and Jerry David Pugh, escaped through an air shaft, grabbed a prison employee's car and got out through the main gate. At approximately 1 A.M. we believe they robbed a market outside of Cut-n-Shoot and killed the store's owner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the prison employee with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was when they left the prison. Sally and Adler enter the room and stand beside the lectern observing. Red notices them. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 35   CONTINUED:                                                     35 REPORTER #2 What's the rap sheet on these guys like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long as Christmas eve to a kid. Haynes was doin' 40 for armed robbery and Pugh was ridin' 20 hisself for manslaughter and assorted parole vios.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there any indication of...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Lemme' finish, Billy. This mornin' another hostage was taken... from a private home in Madisonville. A boy, age 8. Grabbed him out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any sex offenses on Haynes or Pugh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' askin' if they're preverts.   Well, one is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got inter-agency cooperation on this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Texas Rangers as the criminal investigation arm of the D.P.S. share responsibility with the F.B.I. due to the kid being taken. But I doubt they're out of bed yet. A few chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red, how do you plan to apprehend the escapees?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officially I can only say we have a full manhunt team on their trail and we'll proceed with due haste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And unofficially? Red hesitates a moment, something's bothering him, then blurts out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unoffically? I'm gonna' hunt 'em like the rabid dogs they are. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 35   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all I've got but I'd like to introduce ya' to Miss Sally Gerber. She's straight from the Governor's office. Knows all about psychological profiles and the like. You probably have some questions for her. Red steps back and to one side. Sally is taken aback but then warms to the idea and steps to the podium for her first press conference, ready to take on the tough questions, to show off a bit, but.... There are no questions. In fact there is utter silence as every raised hand drops. Eyes stare. Red sighs and starts to walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, fellas, I got work to do. And he heads out the door, followed by Sally's eyes and every reporter's in the room, who commence once again to yell out questions and mob after the Chief. Every reporter, that is, except one. He's near the back of the room and he smiles and raises his hand. Sally, unsure what to do, looks to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I do. Sally smiles a bit then puts on her serious face awaiting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You doin' anything tonight? Sally, steamed, glares at the guy and stomps out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious! 36   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                         36 Butch is driving with Phillip in the front seat beside him, still in his underwear. Jerry, in the backseat, leers at Butch, aims out the window and FIRES ONCE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 37   EXT. FIELD NEAR ROAD - DAY                               37 An aluminum water tank spews a violent leak. 38   INT./EXT. CAR - DAY                                            38 BUTCH We got a handful of caps and yer' shootin' water tanks. He's a smart guy, huh, Phillip? Phillip doesn't move or change expression. Jerry smiles, almost to himself, and FIRES TWICE more for the hell of it. The ROOF of the Impala EXPLODES with two holes as the car speeds off down the highway. 39   EXT. PARKING LOT - DAY                                         39 Red is finishing up with several reporters near the door to the parking lot. Adler jumps in, holds up his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, that's it, boys.   Chief's got work to do. Red and Adler move through the parking lot to SAUNDERS, 50, an aide to the Governor. Saunder's seconds are a PHOTOGRAPHER, young and energetic, and SUTTLE, 35, dark-haired, with a cowlick. Saunders shakes Red's hand and they turn to gaze upon... '60-STYLE AIRSTREAM MOBILE HOME parked in the middle of the lot hitched to the back of a new Chevy truck. The Airstream is painted in state colors and sports banners, decals and logos. 40   EXT. PARKING LOT - DAY                                         40 Saunders follows Red as he walks around the showpiece, occasionally kicking a tire or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So whattaya' think? Saunders motions for the Photographer to come closer and take pictures. He moves in next to Red and poses as the camera clicks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are very proud of this baby. Governor Connally special ordered it so state officials and dignitaries can ride in the parade in Dallas. You know President Kennedy's comin'? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   CONTINUED:                                                     40 RED So I hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Latest technology, oversized engine, complete kitchen and sleeping quarters, gun racks, frig, stove, the works. Even got a hot line phone straight to the Governor's office. Red stops circling and nods to Adler, who scurries away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine piece of machinery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's more, as soon as it gets back from Dallas it will be at your requisitioned disposal. Perfect for lots of situations
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The CLANGING wind up alarm CLOCK reads 5:30 and Gladys opens her eyes and gently quiets it with a touch. She groans and rises, not happy but used to the daily ritual required of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Adler stares at Sally then turns to Red with a "never heard the like" look of amazement on his face. Red, roguishly handsome in his tan, western cut blazer, clip on tie and ten gallon hat, makes his way to the door. But, before he exits...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Every hand in the place shoots up and Ad Lib questions fly like bullets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a headquarters on wheels. Red smiles, walks up to one of the Lone Star decals and rips it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Chief?.... Red rips off another decal. Adler and a few others start to load equipment, guns and files into the motor home. In addition they cart out unecessary items: mattresses, etc. and stack them in a pile outside the motor home. The Photographer continues to snap photos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whattaya' doin', Red?! (to Photographer) Stop takin' pictures! Red does away with the parade banner.   Saunders follows behind and tries to reinstate the decal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's jus' not possible, Red. The Governor's gonna' ride it in a campaign parade tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guvner' hisself told me this manhunt was top priority. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S'cuse me. (to Red) This here's Bobby Lee. He's a specialist with the Feds. They want him to tag along. Red stares hard at Bobby Lee, then nods.   Bobby Lee steps into the Airstream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Red, ya' gotta' believe me... Red spots Suttle, 35, bright-eyed, with a cowlick, sitting at the wheel of the Chevy truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dick Suttle, the driver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not anymore.   Bradley. BRADLEY, 35, glasses, moves to the truck and gets in. Suttle shrugs and steps out. Saunders stops Suttle and turns to Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man stays with the vehicle wherever it goes, Red!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how to operate the gadgets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grab a seat. Suttle sets himself in the passenger seat of the truck. Sally emerges from the building, ticked off, carrying an armload of file boxes, and makes a beeline for Red. Saunders gently touches Red's shoulders; a final plea. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please Red, I'm beggin'. I mean, what am I suppose to tell the Governor? Sally arrives but before she can spit out a word...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell John that Miss Gerber here checked me out on it. Red whistles and the ENGINE REVS. Red closes the door as the motor home pulls away. Saunders runs beside the passenger side window and yells in to Suttle, who stares out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a scratch, you hear me, Suttle? Not a scratch! Saunders stops, breathing hard, next to Sally.   She's pissed and overloaded with files. AIRSTREAM about 20 yards down the way, comes to a stop.    A second later the door opens and the steps pop out. Sally walks toward the bus but when she arrives at the door... ... LAUGHTER filters out of the Airstream.   The Airstream moves another 20 feet then stops. Sally waits a full five seconds, then she blows the hair out of her eyes and, against her better judgment, moves cautiously forward, the file boxes getting heavier by the minute. Again, when she gets close... ...the Airstream moves. Sally, boiling mad as her coiffure wilts in the Texas sun, stops, and tosses down the file box in anger. The Airstream stops. LAUGHTER from inside and a   few AD LIBS, i.e. -- "Okay, Okay." More LAUGHTER. Red steps    out the door, turns his gaze back inside and the laughter and  comments stop on a dime. Smiling slightly he turns to Sally,   moves straight for the file box, picks it up and walks back to  the Airstream. When he arrives at the steps he turns, looks to  Sally, who stews and holds her ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You comin' or not? She hesitates only a moment before walking straight to Red, grabbing back her file box and entering in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 41   OMITTED                                                          41 42   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                             42 Sally enters, balancing the   boxes, and glares at the faces surrounding her. A smiling    Red, a grinning Adler messily gorging on a cinnamon roll,   a nervous KAISER, the radio man, and, in the corner, a nasty   smirk from Bobby Lee. When the Airstream takes off again, she loses her balance and drops one of the boxes. Adler and Suttle jump forward to help but she gives them the evil eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got it. She kneels down to pick it up and feels eyes on her.     She looks up to the men staring at... Her skirt, raised a bit, exposing a thigh. She calmly stands and looks to Adler, a piece of cinnamon roll dangling on his chin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got shit on your face. Red can't help but smile as Adler wipes at his face. 43   EXT. RURAL ROAD - DAY                                            43 The IMPALA BLASTS along, kicking up dust and dispersing crows as it heads into a one light township. It slows, however, before the main part of town and slides to a stop near a pay phone booth. 44   INT./EXT. IMPALA - DAY                                           44 JERRY Why the hell we stoppin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you had a cousin near here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So give him a call. See if we can shack there til' things cool down. Jerry thinks it over, leans forward and, in one quick swipe, grabs the keys from the ignition. Then he laughs and crawls out on his way to the phone booth. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 44   CONTINUED:                                                   44 In the b.g. we see Jerry strut to the phone booth and pore through a thin directory. Phillip steals a glance at Butch, who watches his rear view mirror and grits his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd he take the keys?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I won't leave him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you leave him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah. In the b.g. Jerry rips the 20 page phone book in half and returns to the car, half pleased with himself. He tosses the keys to Butch, who starts the car and drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Musta' moved. Prolly' couldn't have heard 'em anyway. Goddam ear's still bleedin'. You ever try that shit again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were in the middle of threatenin' me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't a threat. It's a fact. Butch reaches over, takes Phillip's hand and places it on the steering wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here kid, take the wheel. Phillip, scared at the prospect, nevertheless does his best to see over the dash and keep the wheel straight. Butch turns back over the seat to confront Jerry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In two seconds I'm gonna' break your nose. That's a threat... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 44   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... And that's a fact. Instead of expressing outrage, Jerry slinks back down in the seat wearing a look of pure hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna' kill you for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's a threat. Beginnin' to understand the difference? Somethin' catches Butch's eye and he turns and slows down and turns into... 45   EXT. RURAL STORE - DAY                                       45 The Impala brakes to a dusty stop near the front of the store, which is bordered by a giant hay field. 46   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                      46 BUTCH Okay, Phillip, listen up. I'm gonna' run in here and get some smokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get beer. Butch hands Phillip the revolver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, hold it like this.... And point it right between his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he so much as moves you pull the trigger ... right here... Put your finger on it. Jerry snickers and then laughs maniacally. Butch reaches over and cocks the pistol. Jerry's guffaws stop on a dime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' a fuckin' crazy man. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 46   CONTINUED:                                                   46 BUTCH And that's a fact. I believe yer gettin' the hang of this. Butch steps out of the car and heads for the market. 47   INT. STORE - DAY                                             47 Butch enters.   A short fat man with a fishing cap is sweeping up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How-do.    Where's yer' sodees?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hot in the first aisle.       Cold in the back, in the cooler. 48   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                      48 Phillip's slightly shaking hands hold the pistol pointed directly at Jerry's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever shot a gun before, boy? No answer. Phillip steals a glance at the store, anxious for Butch to return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Powww!!!...    It'll knock you on your ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quiet, mister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. You ain't never shot no gun before. Livin' in a house with three split tails... no Daddy around. You'll prolly' grow up queer, you know that? A bead of sweat rolls down Phillip's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I'm gonna' lean up here real slow, okay? So we can talk. Jerry raises his hands, palms up and slowly leans forward in the back seat. Phillip's hand quivers but he doesn't pull the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There we go. Now we can have a 'man to man.' You are a man, ain't ya'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 49   INT. STORE - DAY                                               49 Butch dumps a six pack of RC Colas, a handful of Moon Pies, a handful of beef jerky and some gum on the counter. 50   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                        50 Jerry's chin is on the front seat now and his arms are draped over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those are cute little underwears you got there, boy. Say does your mama sew yer' name in 'em, initials or anything? Jerry's hand slowly reaches down to the white briefs. He places one finger in the front elastic waistband and slowly pulls it open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatcha' got in there? Jerry sneaks a peek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kinda' puny, ain't it? Phillip, diverted, looks down.    In a flash Jerry grabs the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hand is quicker than the eye. Jerry flicks open the revolver, spins it -- empty slots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sonofabitch. Hell's bells, no shells. 51   INT. STORE - DAY                                               51 The Old Man puts down his broom and ambles to the register.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This be all for ya'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This and a carton of Chesterfields. (beat) Are those .38 shells? Gimme a box. The Old Man puts the cigs and shells on the counter and starts to tally the bill on a notepad. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 51   CONTINUED:                                                         51 OLD MAN With deposit comes to four dollars eighty. Butch reaches in his pocket and extracts the wad stolen from the convenience store. The Old Man takes note. Butch selects a five and places it on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Land's sake.   What line of work you in? The Old Man bags the goods, but Butch takes the shells and puts them in his coat pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used cars. Buy 'em, fix 'em up. Sold a Cadillac down in Madisonville this mornin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say. 52   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                            52 Jerry puts his gun hand around Phillip's neck and pulls the sobbing boy closer. Jerry rests his face on Phillip's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come over a little closer. As Jerry    groans, Phillip seizes the moment and bites Jerry hard on    the ear. Jerry screams and drops the gun, which Phillip    picks up and carries with him as he scurries out of the car    and into the hay field. Jerry, in pain, now with both ears bleeding, crawls out of the back seat and gives chase. 53   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                                   53 Phillip, still sobbing, runs for his life in the hay, which is a full foot taller than he. JERRY no longer stumbling, now grinning maniacally, gives chase, whistling as if calling for a lost puppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna' find you boy.    You best come here. PHILLIP gun in hand, stumbles, falls, gets up, keeps running. He falls again and crawls to a stop. He wipes his tears and balls up on the ground trying to make himself invisible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 54   EXT. STORE - DAY                                              54 Butch exits with a grocery sack. When he sees the car doors open he dumps the groceries in the front seat and looks to the field. HIS POV The hay rustles as Jerry moves through the field. 55   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                              55 Jerry, crouching, moves through the field -- eyes peeled for any sign of Phillip. Phillip lies still. He hears the hay rustling near him and he looks up, squares his body and points the revolver at... Butch, who spots him, motions for him to stay put and holds out his hand for the gun. Phillip hands it over and watches while Butch reaches into the plaid jacket pocket, extracts a few shells and loads the .38. JERRY a little frustrated now, but still moving forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey boy. Hey boy. You better hope I don't find ya'. He spots something -- a dash of color -- and begins to crawl faster. He parts a thick batch of hay and looks up into the gun barrel and eyes of ... BUTCH squatted down,   who levels the revolver and closes one eye. Jerry laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatcha' gonna' do? Hit me with it? Butch reaches into the coat pocket with his free hand and shows a shell or two. Jerry's grin drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me'n you are friends!!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thick as theives. PHILLIP hears a GUNSHOT and runs for his life back toward the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 56   EXT. PARKED IMPALA - DAY                                      56 Phillip runs to the car and hides behind the tire opposite the store and field. In the b.g. we see Butch emerge from the field and walk toward the car. The Old Man, who also heard the shot, emerges from the store with a baseball bat.   Butch arrives at the car, spots the Old Man and levels the revolver at him. Phillip is relieved when he hears Butch's voice instead of Jerry's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then go inside and lie down til' we're gone. The Old Man meekly does so. Butch goes to the car door, opens it and motions to a frozen stiff Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... Get in. 57   EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY                                            57 The truck and Airstream barrel down the highway. 58   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                          58 The place is a functioning mobile headquarters now. Adler on the short wave and tacking up a map, Bobby Lee still in his corner, Red and Sally sitting across from one another at the "kitchen table". In the rear section of the Airstream Red's chair and a mini office for the Chief have been put together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a spot on 'em. A store right outside of Benhur. About 20 miles from here. Adler sets down the mike, sticks a tack on the map and stands back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Push the roadblock on 288 north by 50 miles. Kaiser calls in the instructions. (NOTE:   Kaiser's radio transmissions are not scripted but go on a lot of the time we're in the Airstream. In addition, his  and Adler's direc- tions and missives to Bradley in the truck are not all scripted.) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 58   CONTINUED:                                                       58 ADLER Ya' figger' they're that far along?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I dunno'and neither do they. They're jus' happy to be out. It's a high speed Sunday drive to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sunday drive. I like that. Never heard you use that one before, Red. Sally is watching Red and listening to all of this with a troubled look on her face. Red notices...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somethin' eatin' at you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... perhaps premature, but do you have an auxiliary roadblock plan for when they split up? Everyone stares.    No one ever questions Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you so sure they won't stay together? Sally hesitates.    Red notices...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got somethin' to say, spit it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their situation is one of accommodation. They won't be together long. Silence.   Sally continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haynes and Pugh are opposites. Haynes is a criminal's criminal -- armed robbery, mano y mano confrontation. Pugh, on the other hand, has a rap sheet littered with molestation and petty crime. They'll split sheets soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the hostages? They gonna' flip a coin to see who gets to keep who? Red rises and walks to the sink.      He rinses a spoon. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 58   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's happened before. Either way it's a dilemma they'll address soon. (beat) That's why we should address it now. She looks to Red.   He refuses to return her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have a dilemma. And neither do they. They'll keep one hostage... and get rid of one, if they haven't already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... which one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's a SNAFU, who's John Q. Public more likely to give a rat's ass about -- an innocent boy or a goddam bureaucrat. Red wipes the water off the spoon on his shirt and walks to his office in the back. Adler, Bobby Lee and Kaiser chuckle lightly at their boss's snubbing of the female upstart in their midst. Sally's face glows a bright red. 59   INT. MOTOR HOME - BACK OFFICE                                59 Red sits in his office chair, pulls out the spoon and pours Geritol from a bottle into his coffee. He doesn't even look up when Sally enters, a stern look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk, Chief Garnett.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red. (beat) Why are you so hell-bent on embarassing me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hell-bent on one thing. You hang around long enough you'll find that out. Til' then a tough backside and a sense of humor will get you through a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a fine sense of humor, but the one thing I won't do is be your straight man so you can play hero to a bunch of morons who think you're some kind of hillbilly Sherlock Holmes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 59   CONTINUED:                                                     59 Red sips from the mug calmly then groans, his face contorted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awful. Arthur Godfrey says it keeps ya' young, but I'm not sure it's worth it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This yer' first time out of an office? She refuses to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought so.   What'd ya' expect ya' signed on for? Adler, Bobby Lee and Kaiser all watch the discussion, smiles on their faces. Sally abruptly closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm what? Some dumb schoolgirl who wandered into the boy's locker room? Well you're wrong. I don't mean to boast, but I happen to be one of the two most intelligent people involved in this fiasco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't ask that.    Asked what you expected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expected to be allowed to do the job assigned to me by the Governor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I happen to like the Governor, hunt quail together every year. But deep down he and I know that win, lose or draw this is my ship, not his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Governor as chief executive officer of this state bears ultimate responsibility for...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Bullshit. Responsibility lies with the one that loses sleep; the one with the most ulcers. This mess turns bloody -- and it might -- all it's gonna cost the Governor is a few votes! Me, I'm the one that's... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 59   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one that what? But Red side-steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell ya' what. You think I'm makin' a wrong turn you speak up. Might not agree, but I'll listen. As far as stepped on toes and wounded pride, I'll buy everyone a drink when we head for home. Not until. I got more to worry about. (beat) That sound fair to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well okay then. Sally turns, about to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So who's the other one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If yer' one brain, who's the other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haynes.    He was tested in prison. 60   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                        60 Butch drives and catches an occasional glance at Phillip who sits quietly, but who, too, steals looks at his captor between swigs of RC Cola. He finishes off the bottle. Butch reaches in the sack for another, pops the top on the dashboard and hands it to Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thankyew. (beat) Are you gonna' shoot me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.    Me'n you are friends. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 60   CONTINUED:                                                      60 Butch realizes that in Phillip's eyes he and Jerry were probably friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I was choosin' a runnin' buddy, I'd take you over him any day of the week. 61   EXT. RURAL STORE - DAY                                          61 The RV slides to a stop in the gravel parking lot which is full of state and local police. Red exits first, followed by the others. A LOCAL SHERIFF walks up to greet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got a positive I.D.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir, with only the boy as hostage. But not five minutes ago we found something else. 62   EXT. HAY FIELD - DAY                                            62 PAN FROM a fingertip UP an arm and TO the face of Jerry Pugh. A clean bullethole has left him with a third eye, a bloody back and an entourage of late summer flies. We hear the CLICK of a photographer's CAMERA. BOOM UP TO Red, Local Sheriff and other bystanders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Least now we know who's in charge. 63   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                         63 Butch notices that Phillip is pretty somber as he tugs on another RC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whattaya' thinkin' about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nuthin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I guess you tell me? Phillip nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You thinkin' about yer mama? Phillip sits still.    That was it. Butch brings the car to a stop.    He points to the horizon. Desolate. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 63   CONTINUED:                                                       63 BUTCH I hear ya', Phillip, but look around. I can't very well leave you here, can I? 64   EXT. RURAL ROAD - DAY                                            64 The Impala rests in the fork of a dirt road. 65   INT. IMPALA - DAY                                          65 BUTCH Lemme' ask you somethin'.    You right or left handed? Phillip meekly holds up his right hand.    The car races forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then that's the way we'll go. You ever ridden in a time machine before? Phillip shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you have.    Whattaya' think this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' lookin' at this thing bassackwards. This is a 20th Century time machine. I'm the captain and you're the navigator. Butch points forward through the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out there... that's the future. Butch taps on the rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back there... that's the past. If life's moving too slow and you wanna' project yerself into the future you step here on the gas. See? He does so and the Impala surges forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if yer' enjoyin' the moment yer' in, well hell, just step on the brake here and you can slow it down. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 65   CONTINUED:                                                    65 Butch brings the car to a complete and dusty stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the present, Phillip.   Enjoy it while it lasts. Then he laughs uproariously and steps on the gas. 66   EXT. ROAD - DAY                                               66 The Impala spins out, kicking dirt in all directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir. Time travelin' through Texas! We got to find us a Ford. My daddy always drove Fords, you know that? 67   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                          67 The Airstream sits in the parking lot of the store.   Bradley and Suttle sit up front in the truck. INT. TRUCK - DAY Bradley turns the knob on an intercom speaker system next to the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an intercom speaker system. You can get and give instructions to and from the rear of the vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You push the power button but if you've got the volume turned up... Bradley pushes the power button. The SYSTEM SQUAWKS LOUDLY and then CREAKS TINNILY. Speakers blown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... you'll blow the speakers.   Sheeeit... INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY Red cringes, his ears still ringing from the squawk, and turns to stare at the front of the RV. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 67   CONTINUED:                                                     67 INT. TRUCK - DAY BRADLEY (quiet; to Suttle) This thing's prolly' got a warranty. You oughta' make a list of all the things that are wrong. INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY Red shakes his head and stands in front of the map, placing thumbtacks at crossroads indicated by the circle mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That oughta' put his pecker in a sling, huh, Red? (remembers Sally) Sorry, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't these be roadblocked as well? She points to several other unmarked roads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sooner or later he'll get on a main road. We don't got the manpower to roadblock every farm to market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a perfect world, Miss Gerber, we'd lock arms and thrash the bush til' he turned up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a perfect world things like this wouldn't happen in the first place. Adler hears something on his headset, turns to Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locals are heading out.   Wanna' follow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's sit tight.    He'll turn up. 68   EXT. RURAL ROAD - DAY                                          68 The Impala travels slowly along the road until it edges to a stop by the entrance to a small farmhouse with a truck and car parked in a long dirt driveway. A farmer on a combine works a small field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 69   INT. PLYMOUTH - DAY                                             69 BUTCH Ok, Phillip, we're gonna do some  car shoppin'. You ever play cowboys   n' Injuns? See that Ford sedan? Now I want   you to sneak on over there like an Injun  and take a peek and see if the keys is in  it. Phillip hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't have to if you don't wanna... but I'd appreciate it... You bein' the new navigator and all. Phillip thinks it over then opens the door and slips out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Phillip, check for a radio, too. 70   EXT. FARMHOUSE - DAY                                            70 Phillip, still in his skivvies, legs cut up and muddied from his escape from Jerry, sneaks up to the car and quietly peers into the open window. The keys dangle when his small hand touches them. Phillip closes the door, looks around and then runs pell-mell to the passenger window of the Impala.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's got keys and a radio.   I checked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good man. Phillip holds his crotch and stamps his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we stop at a fillin' station.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This here's nature, Phillip.   Pee in the ditch. Phillip scrambles to the ditch to relieve himself while Butch steps out of the Impala, tosses the keys into the field and walks toward the Ford. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED:                                                    70 The FARMER stops his tractor and notices Butch and Phillip. Phillip, despite his prior urgency, is having trouble coaxing relief. Butch slides into the Ford, pumps the gas pedal and turns the key. The ENGINE GRUMBLES and DIES. The Farmer is walking now, slowly and then at a trot as he realizes what's happening. Phillip finally starts to pee. Butch cranks again and again but the Ford is flooded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start, you sonofabitch! The Farmer runs faster, comes closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, that's my car! Hey!!! Butch floors the gas to clear the flood and the ENGINE finally STARTS. He throws it into reverse and peels out backwards into the road beside the ditch where Phillip continues to relieve himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the car, Phillip! The Farmer, only 30 yards or so away, is racing toward them madder than a wet hen. Phillip tries to hurry but the RC continues to run through him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip!   Get in the car! Phillip pulls his underwear up and races to the car. He leaps into the open passenger door at the same moment Butch steps on the gas and the Farmer arrives and grabs onto the door as it closes. 71   INT. FORD - DAY                                               71 The CAR is SCREECHING down the road but the Farmer holds on for dear life and auto. He claws at Phillip, who does his best to fend off flailing hands and fingers. Butch reaches under the seat for and grasps the pistol. Phillip sees what's about to happen and bites the Farmer's hand as hard as he can. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 71   CONTINUED:                                                     71 FARMER Aaaaaayyyyyy!!!! The Farmer releases his grip on the door and falls backward, summersaulting into the adjacent ditch. Butch places the gun back under the seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddam, boy, how many RC's did you drink anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four. Butch shakes his head and laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thing's for sure. You got one helluva set of chompers. 72   INT. TRUCK - DAY                                               72 Sitting still. Bradley tries to light a cigarette with the lighter but gets no heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lighter don't work. Put that on the list. INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY Bobby Lee sits alone in the back corner of the main room of the RV. He just sits and stares, occasionally smiling cynically at Sally. Adler takes the latest info off the radio while the others listen in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Highway 16 north. Four miles south of Desdemona. Got it. (to Red) Stole a vehicle. Kaiser radios up front, the ENGINE STARTS and the Airstream moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kinda' shape's it in? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED:                                                     72 ADLER What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Ford he stole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owner told the locals they only drove it to church, but it does have a bad emergency brake. (to Sally) How'd ya' know it was a Ford?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He likes Fords. Adler looks at the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like you was right, Red. He's off the farm to market and onto a spur. Whattaya' wanna' do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beef up the I-20 roadblock. Adler gets more news through the headsets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? (beat) Red, the locals wanna' know if they're to take a clean shot if they get one? Red stares out the window for what seems like an eternity...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Adler looks quizzically at Red and pulls off the headphones...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back...? Come back Mobile One. Adler, are you there...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell 'em what I said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that a negative? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, er, yes. No means negative.     Same thing. Over. Red sees Sally peering at him over the top of her file.      He glances around at the other sets of eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want some half-ass Sergeant York taking pot shots with a deer rifle. Adler puts the headphones back on. Bobby Lee smirks a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the only thing to do.    He's got the child with him. Red gives her a look that says, "Don't defend me".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I suppose you figger' he'll jus' give up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe, maybe not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now there's a safe bet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll give you a safe bet. The boy's in better hands now than he was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The third eye Pugh's sportin' on the way to the morgue shouts otherwise. Sally flashes Red a look back. Bobby Lee rises and moves past Red on his way to the toilet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why not shoot to kill. Red just stares at Bobby Lee as the younger man moves slowly past him to the toilet. Adler on the radio... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've forwarded the stolen vehicle license to the roadblocks. You still wanna' go to the farm? Red pulls out a package of Red Man chewing tobacco and mulls over the question while he slaps a wad into his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.     I gotta' hunch. 73   INT. FORD - DAY                                                   73 BUTCH You got blue eyes don'tcha', Phillip? Never met a blue-eyed Phillip before. Who you named after?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and your old man get along all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeahsir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toss the ball around, play grab-ass in the yard, that sorta' thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nawsir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the hell not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't around, really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well he is or he ain't.       When's the last time you saw him? Phillip shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me'n you got a lot in common, Phillip. The both of us got blue eyes, we both like RC Cola and neither one of us has an old man worth a damn. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED:                                                         73 PHILLIP (a bit defensive) My Mama says he'll prolly' come back. Prolly' when I'm ten or so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... she's lyin' to ya' pure and simple. He ain't never comin' back. Disappointment registers on the boy's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys like us, Phillip, we gotta' be on our own. Seek foolish destiny, that sorta' thing. 74   EXT. GAS STATION - DAY                                             74 The Ford pulls off the dusty road and into the lone pump in this dilapidated petrol mirage. A BUCK TOOTH BOY, 15, in overalls steps to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do ya' for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fill-er-up it is. The attendant starts to pump the gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See there! All you gotta' do is say your name and people are waiting on you hand and foot. Like a goddam king or somethin'. Phillip can't help but smile at the notion. 75   EXT. FARMHOUSE - DAY                                               75 Bradley and Suttle lean against the parked RV, chatting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You responsible for engine maintenance on this thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah.     I'm the full time driver. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75    CONTINUED:                                                     75 Bradley shakes his head.   "Too bad".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You notice how it keeps    wanting to slip a bit goin' into second.     Feels to me like somebody's been a little    heavy-footed with the clutch. (beat) I'd take care of that if   I was you. PAN TO: an ambulance door opens and the Farmer, strapped in, is rolled toward it as his wife, sobbing, attends to him. Several local police scour the surrounding field, walking four feet apart, looking for what they hope they won't find. Red leans on the trunk of the Impala, chews and spits on the ground. He sniffs the air. Unsavory. Adler strides up from the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No bodies this time, thank Gawd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the keys to this thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... naw...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me a crowbar. (to Sally) You might wanna' wait in the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thank you. 76A   INT. TRUNK - DAY                                               76A But it's black as night. A   CROWBAR CRANKS at the lock until the trunk blasts open like a  bottletop. A blast of light gives way to the silhouetted  faces of Red, Adler and Sally, who turns and walks away in  nauseous disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.... THEIR POV - OPEN TRUNK In it lies the crumpled, bent, bloody remains of Larry, the prison employee, the original hostage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... there's our bureaucrat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 76B   RED                                                            76B spits a chaw, turns and walks to the RV.    Near the entrance Sally is heaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's sure nice to know the boy's in good hands. Sally straightens herself, ready to bite back, but Red's face is soft. He offers a handkerchief. She takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gallows humor, Sally.    Without it we'd all be heavin'. 77    EXT. SMALL TOWN (NOODLE, TEXAS) - DAY                          77 The Ford slides down the Main Street and into a side alley next to a Department Store. 78    INT. FORD - DAY                                                78 BUTCH You ready to get out of those skivvies and into some britches? Phillip nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well all right then. But first we gotta' come up with some A.K.A.'s, fake identities, ya' know. Names to call each other when we're around other folks. (beat) Go ahead and think one up. Whatever name you want. Phillip is amused by the sport of it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any name I want? 79    EXT. STORE FRONT - ESTABLISHING - DAY                          79 A small time Dry Goods store with a sign over the entrance proclaiming: "FRIENDLY'S - The Friendliest Store in Texas!" 80    INT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                          80 A small, well-organized country dry goods store with a dozen or so aisles carrying everything from DDT to used boots. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:                                                       80 A long counter at the front of the store is backed by a small office with a large glass window that gives the Manager, MR. WILLITS, 45, bespectacled, anal-retentive, a clear view of the store. A nuclear family with two kids exits the store just as Butch and Phillip enter. Butch holds the door open and smiles at them. They say "thanks" but can't help but notice Phillip, cowering behind Butch, still clad in his underwear. He hides behind a nearby display which reads: Cast Your Vote For Friendly's Friendliest Clerk! A clerk, LUCY, 30, holding a handful of shoeboxes notices their entrance. She's schoolmarmish with a smile that looks like it's painted on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hello there and welcome to Friendly's. Looks like the little fella' needs some pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a matter of fact. Shoes and new skivvies, too. He'll tell you his size. Go with the lady, Buzz. Phillip, still in somewhat of a daze, doesn't recognize his own "name".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz! Phillip snaps to, cracks a smile at Butch and follows the lady to the children's section of the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz, what a cute name.   Like a bee. BUTCH walks past the cash register, gives the clerk behind the desk a wink and proceeds to an aisle which features hardware, rope, tape, nails, etc. He stoops and grabs a shank... ... with his hands he grips the rope tight and jerks it taut. CHILDREN'S AISLE Lucy is holding jeans up to Phillip's waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'd be easier if I knew your size, but we'll get it right. Phillip's eye catches something... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:   (2)                                                    80 HALLOWEEN COSTUME DISPLAY on a circular rack with shelves. Hanging prominantly is a Casper the Friendly Ghost costume. Above it a sign reads: "MARKED DOWN - Get the Jump on Next Year!" CLOSEUP - PHILLIP mesmerized by the display. BUTCH takes a roll of electrician's tape. He tears off a strip, attaches it to the back or his hand and tugs. It holds tight. LUCY kneeling, looking for sizes, selects a pair and turns to find Phillip gone. She spins around and smiles when she sees... PHILLIP wearing the Casper mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why look.     It's a friendly ghost.   Say 'Boo.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boo.
