direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not    very scary but you'll have a whole year    to work on it if your Daddy lets you    have it. Good price, too. What'd you    go as this year?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bandit. 81   EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY                                              81 A local police car cruises slowly, spots the Ford parked in the alley and comes to a halt. 82   INT. POLICE CAR - DAY                                               82 The cop, TERRANCE, 25, who only started last month after he flunked out of Texas A&M, checks the plates against a notepad on his dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw... shit... 83   INT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                               83 Butch, with a handful of supplies, including the rope and tape, makes his way to the register. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 83   CONTINUED:                                                      83 He's greeted there by PAULA, to whom he earlier winked. She's 25, country cute, and wears a fake smile that rivals Lucy's. Butch reaches for and tries on a pair of sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whattaya' think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look good. He adds them to the pile of stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will that be all for you today? Butch nods and hands over the goods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You folks are about the grinninest bunch I ever seen. Paula laughs, then drops her grin, looks behind her to see Mr. Willits is watching, and whispers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Man Willits holds a contest ever' month. The friendliest clerk gets a $20 bonus. (beat) There's a ballot box at the front. BEHIND GLASS Mr. Willits adjusts his black and white TV and settles on a local news broadcast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... the hunt continues for Butch Haynes, who escaped last night from the maximum security unit over in Huntsville. Haynes, six-one, 185 pounds, with brown hair is considered armed and dangerous. He was last seen... CHECKOUT COUNTER Paula checks Butch's items as Lucy and Phillip emerge from an aisle and drop a pair of jeans and sneakers onto the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the clothes, but Buzz has his heart set on a Halloween costume for next year. It is half off. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 83   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Haynes is believed to have an
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Adler moves through the door to the RV carrying Red's favorite desk chair. He's followed by BOBBY LEE, 20's, cocksure, wearing a plain khaki uniform and boots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Before Jerry has time to snicker Butch hits him full in the face and grabs the gun. Blood spurts from Jerry's nose and the injured man cups his hands over the wound. Butch spins and retakes the wheel from a frightened Phillip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Red catches himself about to get too personal. He takes another swig of his coffee/geritol. Sally softens her stance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . WILLITS pays more attention to Butch as the newscast continues.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: year-old boy with him as hostage. CLOSEUPS - BUTCH AND WILLITS Each checking out the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get it next time.   Go get in the car, son. 84   EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY                                          84 Terrance pulls his black and white to one end of Main Street and parks it across the street, blocking it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Pete, I'm all set down here.    You? ANOTHER COP PETE, 40, probably Terrance's uncle, slides his black and white to the opposite end of the street and puts it in park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Copasetic. Let's just keep him tied up til' the state boys get here. 85   INT. RV - DAY                                                   85 Adler takes the urgent message off the radio and turns to the group...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've got him penned down in Noodle, north of Abilene. 86   INT. FRIENDLY'S - AT COUNTER - DAY                              86 Paula bags the items, including the jeans. CLOSEUP - WILLITS staring straight at Butch. CLOSEUP - BUTCH shakes his head at Willits -- "Don't even think about it". (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 86    CONTINUED:                                                   86 PHILLIP walks toward the front door but stops short when he sees, once again, the Halloween display. BUTCH pays Paula, then stuffs a $20 in her blouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are truly the friendliest clerk I ever met. She blushes a "thank you" as Butch makes a hasty retreat to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for shopping Friendly's! 87    EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY                                       87 Butch exits the store, spots the blackandwhites, and slides into the middle of a group of old-timers moving down the sidewalk at a leisurely pace. 88    INT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                        88 Phillip stands at the costume display, looks around, then grabs a Casper costume carton, stuffs it under his T-shirt and walks quickly to the door. 89    EXT. SIDE ALLEY - DAY                                        89 Butch slides away from the Old Timers and into the Ford. 90A   INT. FORD - DAY                                              90A Butch checks the back seat. No Phillip, no Buzz.   He checks the rear view mirror and sees... 90B   IN REAR-VIEW MIRROR                                          90B Pete, his cherry top spinning, pulls in behind Butch, blocking his entrance to the main street. 91    EXT. SIDE ALLEY - DAY                                        91 Butch throws the Ford into reverse and steps on the gas. Pete not expecxting this kind of pace, at least not from the get-go, leaps into his back seat. The Ford rams into the black and white pushing it backward into a lightpole and a truck. The TRUCK'S OWNER, carrying mulch from the feed store, watches as his truck slides toward him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 91   CONTINUED:                                                     91 TRUCK OWNER Dammit, Pete!!! 92   EXT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                          92 Phillip steps out the door.    He spots the crash and watches as... The Ford blasts back into the alley in a hail of dust. 93   INT. FORD - DAY                                                93 Butch, driving like a maniac, turns into the back alley and steps on it. All at once he mashes on the BRAKES and comes to a SQUEALING stop. HIS POV The alley is a dead end. BACK TO SCENE Butch rips the CAR into reverse and SQUEALS all the way back to the original side alley. 94   EXT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                          94 Phillip stands frozen, scared, not knowing what to do but keeping a look out on the street for the Ford. 95   INT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                          95 Lucy and Paula peer from behind the counter at Phillip and the fracas taking place in the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew something was wrong from the get-go. They spot Phillip standing a few feet in front of the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, he left his little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And look, the little rascal has... he's no better than...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got that Casper costume.   He stole it! 96   EXT. MAIN STREET - DAY                                         96 The FORD emerges from the side alley once more and SQUEALS onto Main Street. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 96   CONTINUED:                                                     96 TERRANCE can't believe his eyes... HIS POV - FORD is COMING STRAIGHT FOR him, hell bent on destruction and picking up speed. BACK TO SCENE Terrance sticks his black and white in rapid reverse and backs down the street at 40 mph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the hell outta' there. We can't lose both vehicles! TERRANCE'S POV - FORD is GAINING ON him -- he can actually SEE Butch's grimaced face -- when suddenly it goes into a dusty fishtail, does a 180, and barrels in the OPPOSITE direction. PHILLIP antsy as hell, stuck, wondering how this whole thing is going to play out. He's suddenly aware of the peering eyes behind him. Lucy bangs on the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz! You little shit.   Shoplifting is a crime! BUTCH checks his mirror, looks ahead, spots Phillip and blasts straight for the front door of the store. He SKIDS to a halt and stares right at Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up to you, Buzz... PHILLIP He's frozen for a second, his knees knocking, teeth chattering, the works. Lucy appears behind him and the glass door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll never get away with this, little mister! Phillip dashes to the Ford and makes a swimmer's starting dive into the open passenger window. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 96    CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch pulls his GUN and FIRES once into the glass door above the clerk's heads. 97    INT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                        97 The GLASS DOOR and surrounding WINDOWS SHATTER into a million pieces, sending Lucy, Paula, makeup, pantyhose, grins and all into a heap on the floor. 98    EXT. STREET - DAY                                      98 The FORD SQUEALS out down the street. Pete crawls out from behind the seat and ducks again just as... ... the Ford sideswipes the black and white for good measure and fishtails out of town. Pete crawls over the back seat again as his radio SQUAWKS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pete?... Pete?   You okay?... 99    INT. FRIENDLY'S - DAY                                        99 Paula emerges from behind the counter and stares at Lucy, on the ground amidst glass and mayhem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say what you want. I'm keepin' the twenty. 100   EXT. RURAL ROAD - DAY                                        100 Two young, country boys stand by the side of the road. One, FRANK, tosses an egg from hand to hand while he watches the horizon. The other, BILLY, approaches, crawling through a barb wire fence dragging something behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up.   Someone's comin'. ON HORIZON Sure enough, a hail of dust signals the approach of a vehicle a mile or so away. Billy crawls into the ditch next to Frank. We see what he's dragged from the field -- a scarecrow with a floppy hat and red bandana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick it in the road. Hurry up. Billy does so, propping the scarecrow into a sitting position with a forked stick. Then he races back to the ditch and slides in next to Frank to divide the eggs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 100   CONTINUED:                                                      100 FRANK We got seven eggs. I get four to throw and you get three... since it was my idea. Billy nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here they come.   Aim for windows and get ready to run. The car crests the hill, followed by another, and another and a final one, all Highway Patrol, all with their lights on and SIRENS WAILING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit! The cars don't even slow at the sight of the scarecrow, blast- ing right through it, sending hay, hat, limbs and all, flying. The scarecrow, or what's left of it, lands in a ditch next to the boys. In unison they breathe a sigh of relief, look at each other, drop the eggs and hightail it for home. 101   INT. FORD - DAY                                                 101 The car is parked in a field of some sort.   Butch reaches in the back seat for the bag of clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, take them nasty skivvies off and put on yer' jeans. He spots Phillip's not so successful effort to hide the costume box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatya' got there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ghost suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the store?   You kyped it? Phillip nods, expecting the worst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, hell, Phillip, put it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ain't mad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's unnerstan' each other here. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 101   CONTINUED:                                                     101 BUTCH (CONT'D) Stealin's wrong, ok? But if there's somethin' you need bad and you ain't got the money, then it's okay to take a loaner on the item. It's what ya' call an exception to the rule. Phillip tears into the box, rips out the costume, looks at it, starts to take off his underwear then balks. Butch notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nuthin'. Butch notices Phillip's hands covering his crotch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You don't wanna' get undressed, is that it? Phillip shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You embarrassed caus' I might see yer' pecker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... puny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's puny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well hell, lemme' see. Phillip still hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.   I'll shoot ya' straight. Phillip gingerly pulls off his underwear. Butch smiles a broad grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell no, Phillip, it's good size for a boy yer' age! Phillip, remasculated, smiles and starts to put on the costume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here they come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 102   EXT. RURAL ROAD - DAY                                            102 The four Highway Patrol VEHICLES from before BLAST past at 90+, sending stray dogs and roadrunners scurrying for cover. CRANE    DOWN to reveal the Ford off the same roadside, but behind    a burm in a field. As soon as the patrol cars pass, Butch    STARTS up the ENGINE and humps it to the road and off in the    opposite direction. 103   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                             103 Sally, deep in her files.      She looks up from the file to... ANOTHER ANGLE Bobby Lee who sits by himself, whittling away at a stick and leering at her. Adler is at the map, holding the shortwave mike and wearing the earphones. Behind him, Red stares out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haynes bought tape, rope, and some clothes for the boy. Red comes to and turns to Adler. Sally smiles almost to her- self. She was right -- Haynes is looking after the boy. Everyone knows it, but no one says anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One puzzler though. They say the boy could have gotten away but didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably scared to death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not all. The kid stole a Halloween outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy Jeezus, they're a team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the pit stop in Noodle looks like he's headed for the Panhandle. Red sighs and groans. Unpleasant news but somehow he knew it. He moves to the back room for another shot of Geritol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's more roads than people in the Panhandle. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 103   CONTINUED:                                                     103 SALLY How's that happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor counties. They tend to half finish roads then start on another one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if anybody knows them backroads it's Red. Sally lifts her head, watches Red reenter the room, then stares out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, so... I'm Robert Haynes. Called Butch by everyone. I was born in Amarillo, but grew up in the French Quarter of New Orleans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's she doin', Red?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed a man when I was eight. Silence. Nobody seems willing to play along.    Red turns from the window to Sally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd ya' kill him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shot him with a pistol. There was always one around the dance hall. That's what they called it but it was a whorehouse. We lived there. Red moves away from the discussion and stands at the front of the Airstream, staring out the front window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd the authorities do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The victim was wanted by the locals so the whole thing got shoved under the carpet Cajun-style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't even stick him in juvy? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 103   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put me in school.     Three years behind but I catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like things are goin' okay' now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were.     For awhile.   When I'm twelve mom dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Delilah Jane Haynes hung herself in the bathroom of the brothel. Could have saved herself the trouble. Post-mortem check uncovered last stage syphilis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's yer' father? Red's face tells us he's listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody knows where he is now. Ditched when I was six. He was a small-time felon. Popped up again after Mom died -- he'd just been paroled. Moved us back to Amarillo. A year later I'm in trouble again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?     Kill somebody else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Took a joyride in a Ford coupe that I just couldn't resist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, that's no big deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judge gave me four years in Gatesville, toughest juvy farm in Texas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where the son-of-a-bitch learned to be a criminal. Seen that before, ain't we, Red? Red doesn't answer.     He seems in a faraway place. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 103   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, Butch, why don't you tell us where yer' goin', save us the trouble o' huntin' you down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where I'm going isn't as important as 'Why am I going there?'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. 'Caus' I'm runnin' and they're chasin' and I'd jus' as soon go north as south as east as west. It's a fun lil' parlor game, lady, but right now Butch Haynes don't have the slightest idea where he's headed! 104A INT. FORD - DAY                                                104A Phillip, now fully-attired in his Casper outfit and mask, is looking at a folded map while Butch drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An inch is 24 miles. Hold yer' pointin' finger along the line of the road. You got three lines on your finger, don'tcha'? Each one's an inch. So how many inches to Childress? Phillip holds one finger to the map, then another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One, two... six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' a helluva' navigator, Phillip. A lot smarter than Jerry. But I guess that's not sayin' a lot. Something catches Phillip's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lookie there! 104B HIS POV - TRUCK AND AIRSTREAM                                  104B coming TOWARD them on the highway. 105   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                          105 Bradley, driving, tinkers with a broken windowshade. Suttle yawns, comes to, notices the broken windowshade and gives Bradley a look. Bradley, caught, just smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 106   INT. FORD - DAY                                                   106 BUTCH (excited, too) Seen one of them in a magazine. It's called a motor home. They're new. Kinda' like a house on wheels. Butch HONKS the HORN TWICE and waits for a retort. 107   INT. TRUCK - DAY                                                  107 Bradley smiles, looks to Suttle, who nods an "okay."    Johnson sits on the HORN for TWO solid BLASTS. 108   INT. FORD - DAY                                                   108 Phillip laughs and waves. 109   INT. TRUCK - DAY                                                  109 Bradley and Suttle wave back. SALLY staring out the window.    She looks at the passing Ford. HER POV Butch is hard to make out, but there's no mistaking the Casper outfit Phillip wears with pride. BACK TO SCENE SALLY You said the boy stole a Halloween costume... What character?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe it was Casper... Casper the friendly ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was them.   They just passed us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn this thing around! Adler jumps on the radio to the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn it around! That was them! 110   EXT. ROAD - SAME TIME                                             110 The Airstream slows to a grind, pulls off the narrow shoulder and begins to make a wide U-turn. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 110   CONTINUED:                                                     110 SUTTLE (V.O.) We'll never make it. Stop! It's a close fit but the Airstream just survives a brush with a burm. The TRUCK PEELS away with Airstream in tow. 111   OMITTED                                                        111 111A INT. FORD - DAY                                                 111A Butch checks his rear-view mirror and gets a puzzled look on his face. IN REAR-VIEW MIRROR The Airstream barreling fast behind -- catching up. 111B INT. TRUCK - DAY                                                111B Bradley presses the pedal to the floor. The ENGINE STRAINS. Suttle nervously sneaks a peek at the speedometer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... it's not safe to go over 65 with this much load! The speedometer reaches 80.   The ENGINE SCREAMS. 111C INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                            111C The whole thing is shaking, twisting, bumping.    All aboard try and keep their balance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him to pull up next to 'em! Bobby Lee opens a window and leans out. 111D INT. FORD - REAR-VIEW MIRROR - DAY                              111D As Bobby Lee leans out the window of the Airstream some 50 yards back. NEW ANGLE Phillip turns around backward in the seat to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're goin' fast!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip, you get in the back seat and lie down on the floor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 111D CONTINUED:                                                      111D PHILLIP Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I don't know. 'Caus' I said so! 111E INT. TRUCK - DAY                                                111E Suttle is scared to death while Bradley is loving every minute. The ENGINE starts to STEAM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer burnin' up the engine! But Bradley pays no heed. 111F INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                            111F Bobby Lee unholsters his pistol and leans back out the window. Red spots him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holster that firearm and get yer ass back inside! Bobby Lee thinks it over, shakes his head in disgust and holsters his piece. 111G INT. FORD - DAY                                                 111G Butch spots an opening and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on, Phillip! 111H EXT. ROAD - DAY                                                 111H The Ford makes a sharp veer off the road into a flat scrub brush field. The car spins out a bit when it hits the dirt sending forth a dust devil, then it regains its traction and blasts ahead through the dust. 111-I INT. TRUCK - DAY                                         111-I Bradley spots the maneuver and starts to follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't!!! 111J EXT. ROAD - DAY                                                 111J The truck, in an attempt to enter the field, misses the flat spot, hits a burm with its front right tire and flies into the air. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 111J CONTINUED:                                                      111J The trailer hitch snaps as does the safety chain. The truck lands hard and continues pell-mell through the field. The AIRSTREAM, sans truck, BLASTS forward along the road at 50+ m.p.h. 111K INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                            111K Bouncing like hell. Sally holds on for dear life, then glances out the window and almost jumps out of her seat when she sees... HER POV The truck, 100 or so yards away, blasting through the field toward the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!!!! NEW ANGLE Red spots the same but before he can cuss... 111L EXT. ROAD - DAY                                                 111L The Airstream veers off the road and into the rocky field. Trees, scrub brush and boulders are no deterrent for the sleek silverfish which seems to be moving even faster than before. 111M INT. TRUCK - DAY                                                111M Steam, smoke pouring from the engine. Suttle, covering his eyes, sneaks a peek behind and screams when he sees no Airstream behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhh!!    They're gone!!! Bradley looks in the rear-view mirror, turns around and screams, too. Without visual guidance... 111N EXT. FIELD - DAY                                                111N The TRUCK BLASTS into a mesquite tree, runs halfway up the tree, then dies a horrible death. 111-O INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                           111-O It's an anti-gravity room what with the files, coffee, maps and bodies flying around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 111P EXT. FIELD - DAY                                                111P The Airstream, now losing a bit of steam, hits a burm, almost topples and comes to a precarious stop in a dried-up watering hole. 111Q INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                            111Q Adler, still wearing the headphones, rises first and goes to the radio to answer an incoming call. Red groans. Sally crawls to her feet and offers Red a helping hand, which he accepts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... Red?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They wanna know if the boy looked okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was laughing and waving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell 'em that. 112   INT. GOVERNOR'S OFFICE (AUSTIN, TEXAS) - DAY             112 A large group of very serious advisors sit and stand in a circle around the Governor's desk. Across from GOVERNOR CONNALLY sits a nervous, near tears GLADYS PERRY. An AIDE on the telephone, turns to the Governor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say the boy looked A-okay. Governor Connally nods, sighs, and reaches hand across the desk and touches Gladys's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll be fine, Mrs. Perry. This whole nightmare will be over and done with very soon and you'll be home with your boy. I promise. Gladys, distraught, nods. Governor Connally discreetly nods to a photographer in the group while keeping his hand on Gladys's shoulder. A CAMERA'S FLASH causes everyone to blink in reaction. The Governor shakes it off and continues... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 112   CONTINUED:                                                      112 GOVERNOR I want you to know that I personally okayed the use of a brand-new high-tech mobile home from which to conduct the manhunt. It's an amazingly futuristic piece of law enforcement equipment. Another FLASH. 113 OMITTED                                                           113 thru                                                                  thru 115                                                                   115 115A EXT. FIELD - DAY                                                 115A The Airstream, the amazingly futuristic piece of law enforcement equipment sits beat to hell and leaning to one side in the dry pond bed. All the tires are flat and dents and bruises abound. The door tries to open but is stuck. Red applies a boot to it and the whole thing comes off its hinges and flies to the ground. Red exits. He groans and shakes his head when he spots... Bradley and Suttle limping toward him across the field. Red sighs and starts slowly walking in the direction Butch and Phillip headed. 115B INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                             115B Sally, her hair a bird's nest, does her best to collect her files before she sits down, takes a deep breath and glances out the window at Red in the distance. 115C EXT. FIELD - CLOSEUP - RED - DAY                                 115C Standing in the middle of the field, staring at the horizon. He sticks a chaw in his mouth without diverting or blinking his eyes. 116   EXT. ROAD - CLOSEUP - BUTCH - DAY                               116 Staring at the horizon. ANOTHER ANGLE Butch sits on the hood of the Ford, which is stopped on an asphalt road which, a few feet farther, turns into dirt and a few feet farther a dirt clod field. (CONTINUED) 74. 116   CONTINUED:                                                      116 BUTCH Started this road 20 years ago and it still ain't finished. (beat) Appears to me we got a decision to make. Phillip, aka Casper, exits the car and, imitating Butch, leans against the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's up to you, Phillip. We can backtrack to the highway or we can try it on foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where we goin'? Butch reaches in his back pocket and pulls out a folded postcard. He hands it over to Phillip. INSERT - CARD It's at least 20 years old, crumpled. It unfolds to reveal a beautiful green valley with a snow capped mountain behind it. BACK TO SCENE BUTCH It's Alaska, Phillip. Last of the wild frontier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's pretty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw. Just got the one postcard. But anyhoo, back to our present dilemma. You feel like a hike?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't be more'n, oh, say, fifteen hundred miles. Phillip seems a tad apprehensive about the prospect. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 116   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' prolly' right. Go give our supplies a check. Phillip returns to the car and emerges with the paper bag once full of soda, candy and jerky. Butch surveys the countryside. HIS POV - PAN COUNTRYSIDE Typical midwest Texas; flat, dusty, barren.     A mile or so away sits a home -- a small ranchhouse. BACK TO SCENE Phillip returns with the bag and pores through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A soda... some gum... half a Moon Pie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rations for one at best.    Come on. Butch strides straight into the rocky field. Phillip lingers a moment, then sticks the half eaten moon pie in his mouth and follows, hurrying to catch up. 117 OMITTED                                                           117 thru                                                                  thru 122
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIELD - AIRSTREAM - DAY                                     122A Suttle limps around the broken-down silver junker, his hands covering what his eyes can't bear to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now yer sure that gooseneck had a safety chain? Suttle turns and glares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!!! NEW ANGLE Red walks slowly toward the slumping Airstream. A PHONE RINGS from inside, then STOPS. Adler sticks his head out of the door and calls to Red... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 122A CONTINUED:                                                         122A ADLER Governor's hot line, Red. Governor insists that he have the mobile home back for the parade tomorrow. Red just stares at Adler, then sighs, removes his hat and scratches his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell 'em to come and get it. 123   EXT. DUSTY FIELD - DAY                                            123 Butch continues his hell-bent brisk pace in the field of dirt clods. It's all Phillip can do to keep up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where we goin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're goin' trick r' treatin', Phillip. Phillip stops dead in his tracks. Butch, sensing that the boy is no longer following, stops, spins and faces Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We ain't allowed to trick r' treat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mama don't allow it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trick r' treatin'? Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Against our religion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Against yer' religion.     What kind of foolishness is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jehovah Witness. Butch picks up a dirt clod and hurls it as far as he can.         He sighs and turns to Phillip. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 123   CONTINUED:                                                    123 BUTCH Now, I'm askin' you, Phillip. I ain't askin' yer' mother and I ain't askin' Jehovah. Do you wanna' go trick r' treatin' or not? 124   EXT. YARD OF FARMHOUSE                                        124 Butch and Phillip cross the dirt yard and make their way to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok, Phillip, all ya' gotta' do is knock on the door and when they open it you say 'trick or treat.' Got it? They arrive at the door.   Butch nods at Phillip who RINGS the BUZZER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now wait til' they come. A FARM WIFE, 65 or so, like something from a Grant Wood, only smiling, opens the door and looks out on the pair through the screen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trick r' treat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well ain't you the cutest lil' ghost I ever did see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it again, Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trick r' treat, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, seein' that Halloween was yesterday, I guess you'll have to trick me. You missed the caramel popcorn balls I made up special. Butch smiles, pulls up his shirt and exposes the revolver stuck in his pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait right here. Butch smiles and pats Phillip on the shoulder.    His eyes are drawn to... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 124   CONTINUED:                                                     124 HIS POV - TELEPHONE WIRE which enters the house near the door. We PAN WITH the telephone line FROM the house TO a nearby pole. BACK TO SCENE The Woman returns with an armload of anything she could find in the kitchen. Phillip gratefully opens his sack and watches as the Woman drops in a loaf of bread, a jar of mustard, candies, jams, butter and anything else she could find. Empty-handed she reaches inside the door, opens her purse and dumps her money -- a couple of dollars and lots of change into the bag. Phillip smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thankyew. 125   EXT. YARD - DAY (SECONDS LATER)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip, sack in hand, waves goodbye to the frightened old Woman, who shuts her door and locks it. Butch and Phillip make their way back across the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never underestimate the kindness of the common man, Phillip. Butch reaches up and grabs the phone line, yanks it loose and tosses it aside. 126   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                           126 The Airstream is fast becoming a pig sty. Coke bottles, coffee spills, overfull ashtrays, etc. are everywhere. Adler holds the mike and stares at the thumbtacked map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spur 208 northbound. And 83 at Aspermont coming and going. (to Red) That it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Adler moves to set down the mike and topples a cup of coffee. It spills on the floor. Suttle grabs a towel to wipe it up but realizing the futility of keeping the Airstream clean, he simply throws it aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 127   INT. FORD - LATER - DAY                                        127 Butch drives while Phillip digs through the sack and comes up with a jar of mustard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure there's no meat in there? Spam maybe, Vienna sausages, anything like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nawsir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I bet you can make us some mustard sandwiches, can't ya'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeahsir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well go to it. Phillip breaks out the loaf of bread and lays out four slices on the dashboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Many as you want. Phillip   lays out six more slices. The dashboard is now covered   with bread. Phillip pulls out the mustard but has no knife.    Butch pulls out a stick of gum and hands it to Phillip   to spread with. As they drive  along they pass a large, happy family (Mom, Dad, girl 5, boy 7)  picnicking in the dip of a long hill alongside the highway.   From the look of their brand-new loaded down station wagon  they are on vacation. CLOSEUP - PHILLIP Mesmerized by the family. CLOSEUP - BUTCH Ditto.    He pulls his eyes back to the road, notices something. 128   EXT. ROAD - DAY                                                128 Butch brings the car to a stop near the crest of the hill, sets the emergency brake, grabs the first completed mustard sandwich and gets out, leaving the Impala running. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 128   CONTINUED:                                                      128 BUTCH Be right back. Don't be stingy with that mustard now. Phillip nods and continues piling the yellow goop on each of the slices of bread. BUTCH walks ahead to the crest of the hill, the tallest hill in the county. He takes in the 360 degree view. His eyes settle on... LINE OF CARS IDLING as they wait their turn to pass a roadblock at the bottom of the hill. PHILLIP spreading even more mustard. Then, in an instant, he flips her over, pulls the ribbon from her hair and unzips the back of her waitress outfit to the waist.
