direction.raw_text: Yeah, Phillip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Done proved that ain'tcha'? There's lots and lots of stuff you can do, Phillip. (gets an idea) Reach in that glovebox there. See if Bob's got a notepad or something. Phillip extracts a small ringed memo pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good old Bob. Can you write?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can print.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good enough. Now I want you to make a list of everything you ever wanted to do but wasn't allowed to. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like... cotton candy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cotton candy? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 156   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell I don't know. It's yer' list. Butch settles in for a catnap.      Just as his eyes close...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah?... 157   EXT. FIELD - NIGHT                                              157 Only the dome light and the LOW MUSIC bring attention to the car sitting lonely in the middle of the massive field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ya' spell 'rocketship?' 158   INT. AIRSTREAM - NIGHT                                          158 The aftermath of a full scale Texas Bar-B-Q: plates full of gristle and bone, cigarettes burning in ashtrays and swirl- ing in half-drunk bottles of Coke and mugs of coffee, men groaning and picking their teeth with toothpicks. Bradley, Adler and Suttle are dead-ass asleep and snoring. Bobby Lee, too mean to sleep, sits by himself cleaning his fingernails with a pocket knife. 159   EXT. FIELD - NIGHT                                              159 Red leans against the Airstream and sips coffee from his thermos. Sally walks up, sipping from a mug, and leans against the bumper. Red doesn't even turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figger to give 'em another hour of shuteye, then grab the patrol cars and head for the Panhandle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring back any memories?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too many. Red turns to her.    They both know he's divulged something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They got a file on me, too? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 159   CONTINUED:                                                   159 SALLY It's the 60's, Red. They've got a file on everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just caus' it's written down don't make it true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You worked as County Sheriff in Amarillo and Austin before you became a Ranger. Right so far? (beat) Oh, and it says your name's Cecil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well, that's definitely the worst of it. Red uncorks his thermos and refills Sally's mug.    She takes a sip and almost chokes on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strong... but good. So Cecil... Red gives her a strong look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red. What do you do when you're not at work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The file don't tell ya' that, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a ranch I never visit, nieces I hardly know, a tackle box full of dry lures and a dog that figures he's the owner and I'm the pet.  Could have a point, he's there more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A confirmed bachelor. Any regrets?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liked to have wet those lures. Maybe a new dog. (beat) How'd you get into... whatever the hell it is you do? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 159   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father's defense lawyer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That explains your mouth. Sally smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Instead of Home Ec, I studied Criminology. When I graduated, my father, with the Governor's help, they, he and my dad... I created a position for myself with the prison system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's yer' husband think about all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't own one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' not careful you'll wind up jus' like me. Old, tired, with nobody around to love ya'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's crazy ain't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goin' without sleep chasin' after a three time loser and Casper the Friendly Ghost?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep?    That's what retirement's for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bite your tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna' know what's really crazy? Hayne's juvenile court record lists you as Amicus Curiae. Silence save the CRICKETS. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 159   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friend of the court. Evidence given by a non-party with the intention of swaying the judge one way or the other. They're usually in written form, but there's no copy attached. Red doesn't flinch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, then at least tell me why Haynes got four years for a joyride? What about probation? The boy had a home, a father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your file say about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That he was a petty thief who did a little time, got out and stayed pretty clean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are murderers I'd trust with my mother and petty thieves I wouldn't turn my back on. Your precious files are wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hayne's old man was a career criminal with a soft spot for whores. One way or the other he beat the hell outta' every person he ever crossed, screwed or fathered. Judge sends junior home with the old man and you can bet your last dollar that within a year he'll have a rap sheet as long as yer arm. (beat) I know kids who did Gatesville, made it through, shaped up. Hell, one's even a priest. Sally realizes she's opened an old wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, I don't understand from the file why...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This job ain't about files and books and second guessin'. Ya get one shot and ya call 'em like you see 'em. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 159   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a bit confused... Red tosses out the rest of his coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Texas the bottom line is who ya' know and what they owe ya. That's how I do my job and how you got yours. He turns to walk inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you trying to say? Red stops, faces Sally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bought the judge a T-bone and told him to send the boy up. Told him it was the right thing to do. He went along right down the line. Red disappears. Sally just stares after him, her face once again soft. 160   INT. STATION WAGON - CLOSEUP - MEMO PAD - NIGHT                160 resting on Phillip's lap. BACK TO SCENE His fingers release it as he drifts to sleep. CLOSEUP - PHILLIP asleep, the way a child sleeps.    Soundly. CLOSEUP - BUTCH also asleep, but only his body -- his mind works over- time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 161   SERIES OF SHOTS - BUTCH'S DREAM                                161 (NOTE: the entire dream is a series of snapshots to a strong Coonass beat) A)   A baby snapshot of Butch. (CONTINUED) 105. 161   CONTINUED:                                                     161 B)   A Haynes family photo -- a grizzled father standing behind a mother seated holding a baby. They stand in front of a small, white framed house. C)   Extreme closeup -- The baby in the snapshot - Butch. D)   Snapshot of a young Butch, age 6, with his father and another adult male, who are both holding deer rifles with one hand and with the other the antlers and head of a dead deer. E)   Extreme closeup -- Butch's father from the same photo. F)   Snapshot of Butch, 8, with his mother but no father. G)   An establishing snapshot of a nightclub in New Orleans. The gaudy sign above the joint reads: CLUB - DANCE HALL. H)   A snapshot of Butch's mother dressed in a somewhat sleazy Latino outfit. She's surrounded by 3 or 4 lounge lizard types, whose hands are all placed on parts of her body. She has a drunken sneer on her face. I)   Snapshot of Butch, 8, being taught to dance in the club by his mother. He looks awkwardly into the camera. J)   Snapshot of Butch, 8, sitting on the bar of the club, surrounded by a motley group of sleazy "dime dancers". K)   Another snapshot of Butch being taught to dance by his drunken mother. (NOTE: A heavy MACHINE GROWL should START LOW and INCREASE IN VOLUME through the remainder of these fast-paced series of cuts.) L)   Snapshot of Mom dancing very closely, too closely, to a handsy patron of the club. M)   Snapshot of Mom kissing the same man.   We see a tattoo on his arm. N)   Extreme closeup -- the tattoo. It is of a naked girl. The words "hell-bent" in cursive frame the tattoo. O)   Snapshot of Mom sitting on the tattooed man's lap at the bar. His hand is resting on the inner portion of her thigh. P)   Snapshot of Butch at the bar with the club bartender. Q)   Same as (K) -- Butch being taught to dance. (CONTINUED) 106. 161   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: )    Extreme closeup -- Butch in same photo. S)    Same as (J) -- Butch in bar with dime dancers. T)    Extreme closeup -- Butch in same photo. U)    Same as (O).   Mom with tattooed man. V)    Extreme closeup -- tattooed man from same photo. W)    Snapshot of crime scene in the bar. A man lies      on the floor in a pool of blood. Onlookers, including      some of the dime dancers and Butch's mom, express their     shock at the incident while police photographers and     newsmen look on. X)    Extreme closeups    -- Some of the onlookers faces. Y)    Extreme closeup    -- Butch's mom's face. As  opposed to the others, her    face is rather displaced.  You'd think she'd witnessed    a fender bender instead of a murder. Z)    Extreme closeup -- The face of the victim.      It's the tattooed man. AA)   Extreme closeup -- The tattoo. The ROAR of the MACHINE GROWL is now DEAFENING as the image of the tattoo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 162   BRILLIANT WHITE LIGHT                                             162 that FILLS the FRAME. INT./EXT. STATION WAGON - NIGHT (PRESENT) Except it's brighter than the brightest day as a high power light shines directly at... EXTREME CLOSEUP - BUTCH who exits his dream and enters reality with a throttled shock. He squints and tries to discern the source of the light while groping for his gun under the seat. BUTCH'S POV - WHITE LIGHT It's bright as hell but getting clearer, less fuzzy. We can now see it's the headlights of a huge COMBINE which sits, ENGINE RUNNING, directly in front of the station wagon. (CONTINUED) 107. 162   CONTINUED:                                                     162 A BLACK MAN - 50 or so, KILLS the ENGINE (but leaves the lights on) steps down from the combine cab and starts toward the station wagon. BACK TO SCENE Phillip, now wide awake and scared.   He notices that... Butch is fingering the gun, resting it in his hands and under his right leg. The Black Man, whose name is Mack, crosses the front of the wagon and walks to the driver's side window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't mean to scare ya'. I work at night. It's cooler. Ya'lls car break down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me n' the boy was just catchin' some shut-eye in yer' field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it ain't mine. I just works it for Mr. Andrews. Where ya'll from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drove from Texarkana yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quite a haul.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said a mouthful there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, ain't no sense in ya'll sleepin' in the car. Not when I got a fold out couch sittin' empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't want to put you out.     'Sides we need to get back on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No trouble t'all. Wake you up first light, fill yer' belly and send you on yer' way. 163   EXT. RURAL ROAD - FIRST LIGHT - DAY                            163 A Highway Patrol car, followed by a tow truck, breeze along the highway. 164   OMITTED                                                        164 108. 165   INT. HIGHWAY PATROL CAR - DAY                                  165 Two officers, MONTGOMERY and HALL, scan the horizon.    They look like they've driven all night. Saunders wakes up in the back seat and leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't pass it did we? Saunders spots the RV on the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There it is. 166   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                            166 The patrol car stops, as does the tow truck. 167   INT. PATROL CAR - DAY                                          167 Hall and Montgomery view the beat to hell RV while Saunders, ready to cry, jumps out and runs into the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good Gawd Almighty. Governor ain't gonna' like this. 168   INT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                           168 Suttle is asleep among the rubble. He jumps to when Saunders bursts in. Saunders gasps when he sees the shape his prize vehicle is in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are they?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, uh, they're gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, uh, four, five hours. Saunders, dejected, starts to move some of the trash from the couch. He sits down and moans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, goddammit, did he say anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 168   CONTINUED:                                                       168 SAUNDERS What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, uh, Chief Garnett wanted me to tell you that the vehicle gets his seal of approval.... Saunders' face begins to turn red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that he wants his chair back. If he was red before, now Saunders is crimson.   A ther- mometer dropped into boiling water. 169   EXT. AIRSTREAM - DAY                                             169 We hear a SCREAM and then a second later, Red's desk chair comes flying out the door. It hits a rock and splits as it bounces. 170   EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY                                               170 Two Highway Patrol cars rocket along, one behind the other. 171   INT. LEAD PATROL CAR - DAY                                 171 OFFICER JONES, a lean, hard-nose of 25, drives. Adler in the front seat, Red and Sally in the back. Not a word is spoken. Serious business. 172   INT. SECOND PATROL CAR - DAY                                     172 ANOTHER OFFICER drives this car. Kaiser rides shotgun working the radio. In the back seat sit Bobby Lee and Bradley. 173   INT. MACK'S HOUSE - DAY                                          173 A COFFEEPOT RATTLES on the stove. Two black hands move the pot and rescue overfried eggs in a skillet on the stove. Two small black   feet dangle from a too-high bathroom toilet. As they    hit the ground we hear a FLUSH. We FOLLOW the feet   DOWN down a short hall and into the living room. As    they pass the bottom of a fold-out couch we... BOOM UP to reveal Butch and Phillip asleep. Butch's arm has found its way under Phillip's head and is acting as an early morning pillow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 173   CONTINUED:                                                   173 A small head pops up on the side of the bed nearest Phillip. The six-year-old eyes of CLEVELAND peer close to Phillip and watch, only inches away, as Phillip sleeps. Phillip's eyes blink a bit and then they open...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aaaayyyyy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aaaayyyy!!! Butch jumps up like a rocket and is on the floor in an instant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aaaayyyyy!!!! Cleve races into the kitchen and the apron strings of his grandmother, Mack's wife, LOTTIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wake ya'll up? (to Cleve) Now I told ya not to do that. BUTCH AND PHILLIP, breathing hard, can't help but laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No harm, Ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Lottie. Mack's wife.     This here's my grandbaby, Cleveland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Name's Cleve.   I'm six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm eight.   Mine's Buzz. 174   INT. MACK'S KITCHEN - DAY                                    174 Butch, Cleve and Phillip finish breakfast while Lottie pours coffee. Cleve and Phillip, hitting it off well, are engaged in fervent storytelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got us a creek down the way. Wanna go later? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 174   CONTINUED:                                                     174 PHILLIP Sure thing. Mack enters after a hard night's work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mornin' to ya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mornin'.   Rest done ya'll some good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna plate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not jus' yet. (to Cleve) Boy, go get my thermos from the truck. Cleve, still whispering and giggling with Phillip, isn't really listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ya hear good, boy?! Mack firmly cuffs the boy's ear and Cleve jumps up and out the door, one hand holding the side of his head. Butch and Phillip both look up at Mack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy don't got the sense Gawd gave a chicken. 175   INT. LEAD PATROL CAR - HIGHWAY - DAY                           175 JONES Want me to stay on Highway 70?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's head on over towards Amarillo. We'll cross him there or wave goodbye at the border. 176   INT. MACK'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY                          176 Phillip sits on   the couch and watches as Butch shows Cleve a trick. Cleve    bends over, puts his hands between his legs and Butch grabs   them and pulls -- a flip. Cleve is ecstatic at the   result. Phillip and Butch laugh along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agin'!   Do it agin'! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 176   CONTINUED:                                                   176 LOTTIE (to Butch) Where's the boy's mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We left her at home this time.   Boy's night out kinda thing. Butch spots an old phonograph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, lookie here. He gives it a spin with his finger and searches through a stack of 78s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Andrews give 'em to us when he got hisself a newfangled one. Butch finds a particular favorite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeezus. Now this is music. You know how long it's been since I heard this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's an oldie all right. Mrs. Andrews' maiden name was Bougeois -- half-Creole herself she is, but Mr. Andrews he don't like nobody to know. 'Suppose that's why he give 'em to us. 177   INT. BATHROOM - DAY                                          177 Mack drops his pants and sits on the throne. He reaches over and turns ON the RADIO resting on the wash basin. A FARM REPORT comes on just as... 178   INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY                                       178 A NEEDLE DROPS on a 78, filling the room with the SCRATCHY sounds of a Coonass waltz. Butch's eyes come to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dance, Lottie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lawd goodness no. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 178   CONTINUED:                                                       178 BUTCH Here, jus' follow me. He takes her in his arms and slowly but surely adjusts her movement to his. After a few rough turns they're not too bad. Phillip can't help but smile as he and Cleve watch and giggle. Butch and Lottie dance, swirling around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Poe, you sure can move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oughta be able to. Was raised in a dime a dance whorehouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' foolin' me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am. My mama would dance their asses out of the fryin' pan and into the back room fire. Butch spots Phillip and Cleve, watching, giggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get on yer' feet, Buzz.     You'n Cleve shake a leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well go on! Cleve and Phillip reluctantly stand and stare at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dance, boys! The little boys do their best to emulate the adults and soon they're laughing and dancing, too. The RECORD STOPS. They all clap and laugh.         Butch hears something... The RADIO in the bathroom. 179   INT. BATHROOM - DAY                                              179 Mack sits, cleaning his fingernails with a Barlow knife as the radio announcer begins a news flash. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 179   CONTINUED:                                                    179 ANNOUNCER (V.O.) Update on the manhunt for the escaped convict. Haynes is armed and extremely dangerous. He is believed to have a hostage with him, an eight-year-old boy. A finger turns OFF the RADIO. We FOLLOW the finger UP an arm TO Butch's concerned face. He sits down on the edge of the tub across from Mack and takes the knife away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be leavin' soon enough. I'll kill all of you if you try anything stupid. Mack swallows hard. 180   INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY                                        180 Lottie quizzes Phillip...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's Texarkana like? I ain't never been there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's real nice. I got a dog named... Phillip and a tree house and... Mack, nervous, enters the room followed by Butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Buzz.   Time for us to hit the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whass' wrong, Mack? You look like you seen a ghost. Cleve runs up to Butch, turns around backwards and puts his hands between his legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do me agin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!   Boy! Get over by yer' Mammaw! Lottie senses something is wrong.   Cleve, too young to smell trouble, persists...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Mister, do me agin'! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 180   CONTINUED:                                                      180 Butch smiles and starts to oblige the boy, but Mack inter- venes and smacks Cleve hard, sending him sprawling to the floor bawling. Butch, instantly enraged, back-hands Mack, grabs him by the collar and tosses him onto the floor. Phillip -- frozen, sitting, watching as things go from bad to worse. Cleve -- confused, bawling, afraid. Butch pulls    the gun from his pants, bends down, picks up Mack by his    throat, presses the gun in his mouth and lifts him into a    chair beside Lottie. He bends close to Mack -- their noses    are inches apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd ya'   wanna' go and hit Cleve for? He didn't   move fast enough for ya', is that it?    Or maybe he gets excited sometimes   and don't hear everything ya' say? You    make me sick to my stomach. Butch spits in Mack's face, then rises and walks over to Phillip and hands him the revolver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Point it at 'em.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't wanna'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Point it! Phillip does so, occasionally wiping a tear from his eye. Mack reaches down and holds Lottie's hand. Butch kneels down to a still-sobbing Cleve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, son, you wanna' flip? Cleve shakes his head "no" between sobs. Butch gently takes the boy and lifts him to a standing position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead. Put yer' hands between yer' legs. I won't hurt ya'. Cleve turns to Mack and then runs to him. Butch walks calmly over and pulls the crying child away from the old man and back to the center of the room. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 180   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He don't trust ya' no more. You gotta' earn that, ya' know? (to Cleve) Put yer' hands 'tween yer' legs, son. Cleve,    still sobbing, does so. Butch reaches down and flips    him, all the while staring at Mack. Each time he flips    the boy, Butch reaches down, grabs Cleve's hands and flips    him again. Finally he allows the frightened child to go to Mack and Lottie. Butch takes the gun from Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz.    Go out to the car and get that rope. Phillip stands frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip!... Phillip slowly rises and walks away.      He stops for a moment and turns his back. EXTREME CLOSEUP - PHILLIP His eyes lock in a gaze with... EXTREME CLOSEUP - CLEVE His sobbing eyes plead for something, anything. 181   EXT. HOUSE - DAY                                                181 Phillip exits the house, walks past an old well to the station wagon. He opens the door, stops, looks back. 182   INT. HOUSE - DAY                                                182 Butch sits on the coffee table across from Mack, Lottie and Cleve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you hold that boy and tell him you love him. Mack grabs Cleve and sets him in his lap. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 182   CONTINUED:                                                     182 MACK (scared) I love you. Butch cocks the revolver and slides forward.     His nose is almost touching Mack's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, old man.    Say it like you mean it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This boy know I loves him, mistah'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, mistah'. I gotta' sense about you. I know you a good man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nome', I ain't a good man. Ain't the worst neither, jus' a different breed. 183   EXT. HOUSE - DAY                                               183 Phillip is at the screen door looking in.     He holds the bag in his hand. HIS POV Butch sits on the coffee table, which is pushed right up to Mack, Lottie and Cleve, who sit on chairs. 184   INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY                                         184 Butch, enthralled with the episode he's directing, almost quivers with anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it, Mack.   Don't cost nuthin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you, Cleve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gawd that's beautiful. Butch spots Phillip standing at the entrance to the living room with the bag. He takes it from the boy, empties the contents -- candy, cookies, bread, sugar and all -- and picks up the rope, takes Mack's Barlow knife from his pocket and cuts off a long shank. Butch takes the rope and begins to tie up the three. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 184   CONTINUED:                                                    184 Phillip stands, stares, aware that something bad is happening. Butch finishes tying, sticks the knife in his pocket and walks over to the PHONOGRAPH. He turns it back ON. The SCRATCHY RECORD plays. He turns UP the VOLUME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can go wait in the car or you can watch. Yer' old enough to think for yer'self. Phillip, unsure what to do, stands his ground. Butch returns to his seat   on the coffee table and stares at the three hostages. He    appears as if he's about to cry, closes his eyes and rests   his chin on the barrel of the revolver while he recites   instructions...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut yer' eyes, Cleve. Mack, you and Lottie hold the boy tight. Shut yer' eyes, too. Phillip, awkwardly aware that he's going to witness an execution, starts to cry out, then squelches himself. Butch seems to be in another world now -- taken to another place and time. A slight smile finds its way to his face, then disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, mistah', ain't no use in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll give you ever'thing we got! But Butch doesn't even hear the words. He slowly opens his eyes, pulls his chin from the pistol barrel and points it at Mack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our Father, which are in heaven, Hallo be thy name...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh... shhh... shhh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Thy Kingdom come, Lawd, thy will be done... here on Earth as it is in Heaven. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 184   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh.. shhh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it wif' me.... Butch looks to Phillip in a strange way, sets the gun on the floor between them, and crawls amongst the candy, gum and wrappers until he finds the electrician's tape. Phillip watches, not knowing what to do. The revolver -- cocked, resting on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Giv' us this day our daily bread and forgiv' us, Lawd, our trespasses as we forgiv' those who tresspass agin' us... Butch rips tape from the roll and slaps a piece over each of their mouths, silencing their prayers one by one. Out of breath, he kneels down in front of them and stares at the three while he reaches his hand behind him for the .... pistol -- but it's not there... Butch looks up to see... Phillip -- teeth gritted, holding the pistol, pointing it directly at Butch. CLOSEUP - BUTCH His expression is blank -- then a slight smile. For a second it's as if none of this has happened, that Butch will grasp Phillip in his arms... A DEAFENING GUNBLAST turns his expression to blank. Phillip, knocked to the floor by the revolver's kick, recovers to his knees, shaking like a leaf. The MAMBO RECORD comes to an END, but SCRATCHES ON AD INFINITUM. Butch falls back to his knees, still staring at Phillip. He looks at his stomach, where a stain of brown-red gushes through his T-shirt, and back to the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip?.... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 184   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip, momentarily dazed, stares at the gun in his hand, at Butch, the blood pouring from Butch's side, and the shocked faces of Mack and his family. Then, in a flash, he runs, pell-mell, out of the house. 185   EXT. HOUSE - DAY                                             185 Phillip blasts out the screen door and runs straight to the well. He drops the gun into the well, catches his breath and heads for the road. After a few yards he has a thought, runs back to the station wagon, grabs the keys and throws them as far into the adjacent field as he can. Then he resumes his race for the road. 186   INT. HOUSE - DAY                                             186 Butch gropes to his feet, still in shock. He stumbles toward the door, then stops, reaches in his pocket, extracts Mack's Barlow knife, holds it up and walks toward them, staring hard. Mack, Cleve, Lottie -- Afraid they'll be killed after all. Butch, surprisingly, meekly sets the knife down on the coffee table...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for yer' hospitality. And walks away. 187   EXT. HOUSE - DAY                                             187 Butch emerges and stumbles out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip?!... No answer. He drags himself to the station wagon and, with much effort, slides himself into the seat. No keys. He opens the door, crawls out, leaving a trail of blood, looks out to the road and starts to walk. PHILLIP runs down the road, looking back every so often to see if Butch is following (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 187   CONTINUED:                                                    187 BUTCH makes his way onto the private dirt and starts walking back toward the main road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phillip?!! I won't hurt ya', I swear! PHILLIP is running out of steam on the road ahead.   He stops for a blow and looks back. HIS POV A few hundred yards back, Butch struggles forward. BACK TO SCENE Phillip crawls through the ditch beside the road and squeezes through a barb wire fence. His costume hangs on a barb. He rips away from the fence leaving a foot-long strand behind. In the b.g. -- a pickup truck drives by. 188   INT. TRUCK - DAY                                              188 ARCH ANDREWS, 50, the owner of the Ranch, slows down when he sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell?... HIS POV - PHILLIP clad in his white costume, running across a field toward a grove of trees beside the creek. BACK TO SCENE Arch continues on down the road and passes... Butch -- nearly in shock, stumbling down the road. TRUCK pulls into Mack's place, and Arch gets out, peers into the station wagon, sees blood, grimaces and walks up to the house. He notices a dripping trail of blood on the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 189   INT. HOUSE - DAY                                                189 Arch enters the kitchen, sees no one and starts toward the living room. The MAMBO continues to SCRATCH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mack?... Lottie?... Arch enters the living room and stops when he sees Mack and family, still gagged and tied to the chairs. 190   EXT. ROAD - DAY                                                 190 Butch, holding his side, the pain is worse as he stumbles along. He stops when he spots something -- a piece of white costume on the fence. He crosses the ditch, steps through the fence and walks in the same direction Phillip did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a helluva' thing to do, Phillip. You're a hero. Prolly' be in all the papers tomorrow, how you saved those folks. Truth is, I don't think I woulda' killed 'em. I only killed two people in my whole life. One hurt my mama and one hurt you. 191   INT. LEAD PATROL CAR - DAY                                191 Adler listens in on the shortwave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A town called Happy, over in Swisher County.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half-hour tops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get on the radio and tell whoever gets there first to play it nice and easy. Sally gives him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've got the boy's mother flyin' in on a private. You want her on standby? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 191   CONTINUED:                                                   191 RED Jeezus, who did that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guvner, I assume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a bad idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead and chopper her in. After a moment of silence, Sally turns to Red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean to pry last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, ya did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Red, it was 20 years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny thing. When the judge sent him away the kid stared at me. Like he knew. Not hard or mad like you'd expect. It was... It was like he was forgiving me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgiving you for what?! For looking at the facts and doing what you thought was right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw.   For what's gonna happen today. 192   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                             192 Butch follows Phillip's path through the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What say we talk this over? Settle things man to man. Then we can be on our way. I'll even let you drive. Knock that right off yer' list. How'd that be? PHILLIP finally arrives at the creek, looking over   his shoulder all the way. He looks at the water -- deep and    running swift. Where to go? He decides and heads for the    nearest tree -- a big oak, and shimmies up to a branch ten   feet or so above the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 193   INT./EXT. LOCAL BLACK AND WHITE - DAY                         193 A country cop answering the report, drives slowly down the road, his pistol drawn and held upright in one hand. He pulls into Mack's driveway and parks. Arch walks out of the house to greet him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's his car. Took off on foot. He's got a pistol. Mack says it looks like a .38. 194   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                              194 Butch stops to rest.   Something catches his eye. HIS POV A white figure moves slightly in the boughs of an oak tree. Phillip tries to climb higher but can't reach the next limb. BACK TO SCENE Butch walks underneath the tree without even looking at Phillip. He sits down to rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alaska, Phillip.     Wild and wooley. Man against nature.     Me personally, I like them odds. (beat) Did I tell you my   daddy lives there? He's the one that   sent the picture postcard. Listen    here to what he says about it... Butch pulls the postcard from his back pocket and reads...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Dear Robert'... that's my real name, Phillip. Robert. Jus' like old Bob the family man. 'Dear Robert, I just wanted to tell you that me leaving has nothing to do with you.' Phillip, still afraid, can't help but listen as Butch suffers through his memories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Alaska is a beautiful place.    Colder than hell most all the time. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 194   CONTINUED:                                                   194 BUTCH (CONT'D) Someday you can come and visit and we'll maybe get to know each other better.' Short and sweet. That's the old man's style. 'Cold all the time' -- like that's a big sellin' point. He laughs to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He useta' pat me on the head and tell folks 'that it's some that can live life without askin' about it and it's others has to know why, and this boy here is one of the latters.' (beat) That's why I wanted to go up there. To visit the old man, I guess. Prolly' punch him one first, but then maybe we'd end up bein' friends, sit down, have a beer, talk things over.... Butch groans. He pulls his hand from his side. Blood is oozing all over the place. He returns the postcard to his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll jus' rest awhile. Then you can make up yer' mind. How's that? Phillip, still clinging to the tree, can't help but feel compassion for his friend. 195   EXT. MACK'S HOUSE - DAY                                      195 A dozen Highway Patrol cars now sit in the driveway. The Fed in charge, AGENT HENDRICKS, assigns different officers to secure the area in an incredibly organized fashion. Mack, Lottie, Cleve and Arch watch from the porch. 196   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                         196 Butch's eyes are closed. A small puddle of blood drips and becomes a rivulet running down into the creek. Phillip, still in the tree, still watching, can't bear it any longer. He slowly climbs down and drops next to Butch, who opens his eyes to the boy and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thing's for sure now -- I definitely believe in ghosts. (beat) Never been shot before. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 196   CONTINUED:                                                    196 PHILLIP I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know ya' are. Truth is, if it had to happen, I'm glad it was you. As opposed to someone I don't know, I mean. All things considered, I feel pretty good, though. Could use a beer, though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's beer taste like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, it's about the best thing there is. You'd better put that on the list. Phillip's eye catches something.     He stands up fearfully... HIS POV - TWO MORE PATROL CARS lights spinning, rushing down the road, kicking up dust. 197   INT./EXT. RED'S PATROL CAR - DAY                              197 Sally watches Red. When the car comes to a stop, she reaches out and touches his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think our chances of this thing ending peacefully are good. He smiles a lonesome smile, opens the door and exits. 198   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                          198 Phillip kneels back down to Butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw, Phillip, I need me a time machine with a loud radio to take me where I'm goin'. Walkin's for squares. 199   EXT. MACK'S HOUSE - DAY                                       199 Red exits his patrol car, followed by Sally.     Agent Hendricks walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Garnett, I'm Tom Hendricks, F.B.I., out of the Amarillo office. I understand you have one of our men with you? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 199   CONTINUED:                                                    199 RED Yeah.   You got the area quadroned off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water tight. Like a frog's pussy. (notices Sally) Sorry, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No doubt an observation based on personal experience. Red can't help but smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got him spotted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the creek, half-mile down the road. I spaced officers in a circle around them
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as if he hasn't seen him in years)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: yards or so away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got any problem with me handling this one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What say we both handle it? Red sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's head on down there.     Bradley, gimme' a megaphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One other thing, Chief. Haynes is wounded. The boy gut-shot him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' shittin' me. 200   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                          200 Phillip scoops a handful of water and brings it to Butch, who opens his mouth and drinks, A megaphoned voice interrupts...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch, this is Red Garnett of the Texas State Police. A thin, knowing smile crosses Butch's lips. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 200   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know yer' hurt. We've got damn near
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: armed men here. Take a look around and you'll see I'm shootin' ya' straight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this for me. I'm touched, but I'm afraid ya'll gonna' have to back it up a step or two. I'm headed to Mexico. (to Phillip) Lyin' to 'em, of course. 201   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                        201 Red leans against a patrol car, accompanied closely by Adler, Sally and Hendricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hate    to tell ya', Butch, but yer' headed the    wrong direction. Tell ya' what. You    let the boy go and we'll talk about it.     Discuss it over a cold beer. 202   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                       202 BUTCH (to Phillip) Beer. What'd I tell ya'. (to Red) Appreciate the offer, Cap'n, but ya' know I can't do that. If you and yer' pals back outta' here, I'll drop the boy at the border. (beat) If you don't I'll shoot him in the head. I mean it! Phillip, betrayed beyond comprehension, stares at Butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look at me like that. I don't even have a gun. What did ya' do with the pistola' anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threw it in the well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good thinkin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 203   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          203 ADLER Ya' think he means it? Red mulls it over, replaces his old chaw with a fresh one and looks to Sally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Based on what's happened the past two days I don't think he would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thing's for sure. If he gets outta' here with the boy, we're right back to where we started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he kills the boy he'll get the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, he'll get the chair anyway.   He's killed two in two days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know that he pulled the trigger on either of the innocent victims.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well he wasn't at home in his Strat-O- Lounger. 'Sides, who killed Pugh? Casper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, both of you, that's enough! From the trail of blood I got a feelin' it ain't gonna' make any difference. Let's jus' concentrate on gettin' the boy out for now. Bobby Lee approaches with a leather case, bypasses Red and goes straight to Hendricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where ya' want me, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you shoot off a hood? Bobby Lee nods. In the b.g., a HELICOPTER circles, preparing to land. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 203   CONTINUED:                                                   203 ADLER That'd be the boy's mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring her on over. 204   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                         204 Butch and Phillip watch the helicopter land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, Phillip, dreams do come true. There's yer' rocketship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think I'll get to ride it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today's the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch, we got the boy's Mama here. She wants to say something. Phillip is visibly stunned by the news. He crawls up to the crest of the creekside and squints, looking for his mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, Phillip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my mama. Phillip still cranes his neck to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that ya' got yerself a ghost suit, do ya' think she'll let ya' trick r' treat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got to do one house. Butch smiles.   He has an idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put yer' mask back on. 205   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          205 Bobby Lee carefully unsnaps the latches on his leather case and opens it on the hood of the patrol car. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 205   CONTINUED:                                                    205 Inside is... a high-powered military rifle in three parts. Hands unzip a velvetine bag and pull out a high-powered scope. Bobby Lee holds the lens of the scope to his mouth, blows a breath on it and wipes it clean with a piece of clean cloth. He feels eyes and turns to see... Sally, watching him at work. Bobby Lee smiles at her, cocksure.   His dark role in this manhunt is now perfectly clear. Sally turns her head, disgusted. Gladys Perry, frazzled, somewhat in shock, is ushered forward. She's handed the MEGAPHONE. She fumbles with it, pushes the button. It SQUAWKS LOUDLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jus' push the button and talk normal. It SQUAWKS again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, I'll hold the damn thing. You jus' talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hullo... Hullo. Please, sir, he's my only son. I'll give you money, whatever I can. Please, I want to take my boy home! I want to... The MEGAPHONE SQUALKS one final dying time and SHORTS OUT. Red hands it to Bradley, who immediately sets it on the trunk and starts taking it apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' doin' fine. We'll get another one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think yer' tobacco spit shorted it out, Red. 206   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                          206 Phillip wears the mask.   Butch dusts him off and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ready to go home? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 206   CONTINUED:                                                    206 PHILLIP (very sure) Yeahsir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Cap'n, you got any candy? INTERCUT BACK and FORTH BETWEEN Butch and: RED BRADLEY (re: megaphone) This one's shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, find another one! Red sighs and cups his hands around his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Candy! Halloween candy! Popcorn balls, caramel apples, gum, shit like that?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hungry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find me some candy and I'll deliver up a ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard him. 207   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                           207 Red nods to Adler who starts to gather sticks of gum, mints, anything from the surrounding officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't have another megaphone, Chief. Red just shakes his head and sighs. Bobby Lee leans on the hood of the car and places one eye behind the scope of his rifle. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 207   CONTINUED:                                                     207 RED You all set?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say when, I'll say dead. Red glares at Bobby Lee for an extended moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got yer'self a deal. Candy's waitin'. 208   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                           208 BUTCH (yells) One more thing. His old lady has to swear to take him trick r 'treatin' every year. Phillip strains to look for his mom.    He's upset, ready to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme' yer' list, Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme that list. Phillip pulls it out. Butch snatches it and reads it to himself, laughing. He's on a death roll of sorts, between losing blood and being in an impossible situation he almost seems to be enjoying the macabre scenario as it unfolds. Phillip, on the other hand, is beginning to sob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she's gotta promise to take him to the fair for rollercoasters and cotton candy whenever he wants... or at least once a year...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna' go home!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when he gets older he gets to drink beer... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 208   CONTINUED:                                                   208 PHILLIP I don't need beer!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it's on yer' list. (yells to Red) And to go out on dates with girls! (to Phillip) Not on the list, but you'll thank me later for that little addition. (checks list) Done that, got to drive, gonna' ride that rocketship. That's about it. (yells; to Red) She's gotta' promise or I won't let him go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna' go home, Butch. My mama's not bad! She gives me those things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kid a kidder, Phillip. 209   EXT. ROADSIDE -DAY                                           209 Red, exasperated, he can't believe how weird this has gotten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a deal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make her say it! Red looks to Gladys as if to say, "go ahead".   She seems reluctant. Red's frustration is showing. 210   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                         210 Phillip is near tears. He rises and starts to move for the field, but Butch grabs him with one arm, pulls him close and holds him like he's his own child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I jus' wanna' go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know jus' how ya' feel, Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 211   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                         211 GLADYS (to Red) Phillip knows those things are against our beliefs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kinda' foolishness is that? (yells) She promises!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make her say it! Red gives her a look that says, "Say it or deal with me".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise! 212   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                        212 BUTCH (to Phillip) Can we trust her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a real good mama. Butch reaches into his pocket, extracts the remaining wad of stolen bills, unzips the Casper outfit, stuffs them into the costume and rezips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you get home, hide this. If she's lyin' you can buy yer' own damn beer. Phillip quiets for a moment and stares at Butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yer' not bad, are you, Butch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (beat) Now, Buzz, listen here. I want ya' to step out there real slow, keepin' yer' paws in the air. Then strut right over to them cops and yell 'trick r' treat.' Got it? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 212   CONTINUED:                                                     212 PHILLIP What are you gonna' do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somethin'll come to mind. Butch sticks out his hand.    Phillip shakes it, afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Bye, Phillip.    It's been one helluva' ride. Butch nods and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Cap'n. Make way for Casper the friendly ghost. The friendliest ghost I know. Butch nudges Phillip and the boy starts toward the field. 213   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                            213 Adler, looking through binoculars, can't help but smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme' them things. Adler hands over the binoculars.    Red takes a look. HIS POV - PHILLIP nee Casper, walking in his full whitehood, arms reaching for the sky. 214   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                               214 Phillip reaches level ground and for the first time sees the full strength of the amassed police forces -- at least 20 cars, swirling lights, guns everywhere, pointing at him. 215   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                            215 Red watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Keep walkin'! HIS POV - THROUGH BINOCS Phillip stops walking and stands perfectly still. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 215   CONTINUED:                                                   215 BACK TO SCENE Red lowers his binocs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the hell's he stoppin'? (to Gladys; direct) Call for yer' boy to come! Gladys, near shock, AD LIBS commands to Phillip. "Come on honey," "Phillip, keep walking," that kind of thing. (NOTE: Her commands become more and more shrieking and frantic and continue throughout, giving rise to even more confusion than is already present.) 216   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                             216 Phillip turns back and sees ... Butch -- He tries to get up in an attempt to make a run for it, but his strength is gone. He collapses. Phillip, standing still, with his mother's shrieks filling the air behind him, watches Butch for a second then runs back toward him. 217   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          217 Red sighs and lowers the binocs. 218   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                         218 Phillip stands before a struggling Butch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Personally I think we negotiated a pretty fair deal, but if there's somethin' else you want...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do they want to shoot you? Butch starts to lie to the boy but can't. 219   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          219 A finger strokes the trigger of a high-powered rifle. Bobby Lee -- Smiling, ready, waiting. Red shrugs and wipes his brow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 219   CONTINUED:                                                     219 HENDRICKS He thought better of releasin' the hostage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't necessarily mean that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay on ready. 220   EXT. CREEKSIDE - DAY                                           220 Phillip holds his hand out and helps Butch get up. Butch stands, dusts himself off, grabs the boy's hand and to- gether they walk toward the field. 221   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                            221 Red, through the binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seen it all now. 222   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                               222 Butch and Phillip, hand in hand, walking across the field. 223   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                            223 Red scratches his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell if I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's giving himself up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep in mind -- he still has the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butch! Stop and let the boy go! Put yer' hands up and let the boy go!!! (NOTE:   AD LIB instructions from Red continue as well.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 224   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                               224 With all the yelling, it's hard to make out what's being said. Butch and Phillip continue to walk and talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I guess that's it for Alaska, Phillip. 225   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                            225 RED Stop and put your hands on your head!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run, Phillip!   Come here, Phillip!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chief, we've got an armed killer and an innocent boy out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You clean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a whistle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep him locked down.    Don't squeeze til' I say 'when.' Red holds Bobby Lee's eyes until the young Fed nods.    Then Red unstraps his holster and moves between the cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell you going? But Red's not listening, just walking, long and tall, into the field. EXT. FIELD - DAY Butch and Phillip continue to walk, Butch holding Phillip's hand. When Butch spots Red approaching he slows and then stops. Red shows his palms and keeps walking toward them.     When he gets within 25 feet he stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm unarmed.    Toss your gun on the ground. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 225   CONTINUED:                                                   225 Butch smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had a pistola I'd be headed the other direction. My partner here got rid of the evidence. (beat) Do I know you, friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... not really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm. Well, look I wanna' talk to the boy and then we'll take care of bidness. How's that? Only take a second. Red nods then looks over his shoulder at the patrol cars lined up like a wagon train, guns aimed, Bobby Lee peering through the scope of his rifle. 226   NEW ANGLE                                                    226 Butch and Phillip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna' give ya' somethin'. 227   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          227 HENDRICKS He's stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna make a run for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it a second!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let the boy go, Butch!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he makes a move...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 228   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                             228 Butch kneels down beside Phillip.    He reaches slowly, pain- fully for his back pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mebe' someday you'll get to go... 229   EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY                                          229 Hendricks looks through the binocs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's goin' for his weapon! THROUGH BINOCULARS Butch reaches into his back pocket... IN FIELD Red squints to make out what Butch's reaching for. HIS POV Butch smiles as he retrieves the POSTCARD from his pocket. BACK TO SCENE A look of concern crosses Red's lips... ROADSIDE Sally realizes it's not a gun that Butch is reaching for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noooooo...!!!! FINGER ON TRIGGER squeezes -- An EXPLOSION followed by a RINGING ECHO. IN FIELD Butch's chest explodes when the bullet hits him. He rocks backwards, still on his knees... and looks at Phillip in amazement. Phillip screams, grabs Butch and holds him up. THROUGH CROSSHAIRS OF GUN Phillip is obscuring a second shot at Butch. BUTCH tastes blood and sighs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 229   CONTINUED:                                                      229 BUTCH Damn, Buzz, shot twice in the same day. He collapses and falls into Phillip's arms. Phillip backs away two steps and falls to his knees. Butch wavers for a second then topples on his back. Phillip moans, sobs, as he watches Butch, the GUNSHOT still ECHOING. AT ROADSIDE Gladys runs from behind the car, followed by a host of officers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep everybody back! Bobby Lee stands, lowers his rifle disengages and smiles at Hendricks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to worry.     He can't hurt nobody now. IN FIELD Red stands frozen, staring, in another world. An OFFICER trots up to Butch and does a careful ground frisk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No weapon, Chief! Red "comes to," turns and walks toward the... ROADSIDE Red walks   up to Bobby Lee, stops and stares at the grinning marksman.    After a beat, Red turns then nearly jumps out of shoes with   a sudden right cross that floors the younger man. Red starts   to jump in for more but Hendricks, stunned, jumps in, grabs   Red and, joined by four other Officers, holds the older man   back. Shouting, i.e. "Hey, hey, Red, whoa, whoa!" Red settles a bit. Hendricks turns to Bobby Lee who rises to one knee and wipes at a bloody lip, and then to Red who is still breathing hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell was that all about?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say 'when.' (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 229   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red turns and walks away. Hendricks throws his hat to the ground, kicks it and follows Red with his eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit!! Adler catches up to Red.   He stares at his old friend and boss as they walk along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he had a gun, too, Red.   There was just no way of knowin'. Red doesn't even look at Adler, just keeps walking.    Adler stops, his eyes following Red. Sally, nearby, watches Red walk away. PHILLIP is helped to his feet by his mother. She holds him dearly to her chest. He hugs back just as hard, his blood-stained Casper outfit staining her blouse. She unzips the costume and dollar bills fly all around. She starts to lead Phillip off but he won't leave until... He pulls the postcard from Butch's hand. CLOSEUP - PHILLIP Staring down at Butch. CLOSEUP - BUTCH His eyes flutter a bit with recognition. AT PATROL CAR Red leans against the car.   After a few seconds Sally walks up and finds a spot a few feet down from him where she, too, leans against the car. After a few more seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did everything you could.    You know that. Red just stares straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know nuthin'.   Not a damn thing. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red reaches into his pocket, pulls out his tobacco and stuffs a chunk into his mouth. IN FIELD - CLOSEUP - BUTCH He licks his lips as the MUFFLED VOICES CONTINUE around him. He squints hard and sees: HELICOPTER as it lifts off and speeds away.    As it wipes the sun... CLOSEUP - BUTCH A slight smile crosses his dying face as he squints to see Phillip's flight. CLOSEUP - PHILLIP Nose pressed against the glass bubble. BUTCH His eyes don't close, still squinted but frozen. CLOSEUP - EYES We realize now, are lifeless. BUZZARD continues its flight past the sun. SUN flares, SENDING the SCREEN TO: MILKY WHITE IMAGE that opened the film.
